member.name: T:Ext.Net.RowSelectionModel
member.summary: The default SelectionModel used by Ext.grid.GridPanel. It supports multiple selections and keyboard selection/navigation. The objects stored as selections and returned by getSelected, and getSelections are the Records which provide the data for the selected rows.

member.summary: The registered xtype to create. This config option is not used when passing a config object into a constructor. This config option is used only when lazy instantiation is being used, and a child items of a Container is being specified not as a fully instantiated Component, but as a Component config object. member.name: T:Ext.Net.GridView
member.summary:
This class encapsulates the user interface of an Ext.grid.GridPanel. Methods of this class may be used to access user interface elements to enable special display effects. Do not change the DOM structure of the user interface.
This class does not provide ways to manipulate the underlying data. The data model of a Grid is held in an Ext.data.Store.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.GridView.GetRowClass
member.summary:
Override this function to apply custom CSS classes to rows during rendering. You can also supply custom parameters to the row template for the current row to customize how it is rendered using the rowParams parameter. This function should return the CSS class name (or empty string '' for none) that will be added to the row's wrapping div. To apply multiple class names, simply return them space-delimited within the string (e.g., 'my-class another-class').
Parameters: record : Record The Ext.data.Record corresponding to the current row index : Number The row index rowParams : Object A config object that is passed to the row template during rendering that allows customization of various aspects of a body row, if applicable. Note that this object will only be applied if enableRowBody = true, otherwise it will be ignored. The object may contain any of these properties: store : Store The Ext.data.Store this grid is bound to Returns: String a CSS class name to add to the row.

member.name: T:Ext.Net.CellSelectionModel
member.summary:
This class provides the basic implementation for single cell selection in a grid. The object stored as the selection and returned by getSelectedCell contains the following properties: record : Ext.data.record The Record which provides the data for the row containing the selection cell : Ext.data.record An object containing the following properties: rowIndex : Number The index of the selected row cellIndex : Number The index of the selected cell Note that due to possible column reordering, the cellIndex should not be used as an index into the Record's data. Instead, the name of the selected field should be determined in order to retrieve the data value from the record by name:
var fieldName = grid.getColumnModel().getDataIndex(cellIndex); var data = record.get(fieldName);

member.name: F:Ext.Net.PropertyGridParameter.renderer
member.summary:
(optional) A function used to generate HTML markup for a cell given the cell's data value. If not specified, the default renderer uses the raw data value.
Sets the rendering (formatting) function for a column. See Ext.util.Format for some default formatting functions.
The render function is called with the following parameters: value : Object The data value for the cell. metadata : Object An object in which you may set the following attributes:
css : String A CSS class name to add to the cell's TD element. attr : String An HTML attribute definition string to apply to the data container element within the table cell (e.g. 'style="color:red;"').
record : Ext.data.record The Ext.data.Record from which the data was extracted. Returns: void

member.summary:
(optional) A function used to generate HTML markup for a cell given the cell's data value. If not specified, the default renderer uses the raw data value.
Sets the rendering (formatting) function for a column. See Ext.util.Format for some default formatting functions.
The render function is called with the following parameters: value : Object The data value for the cell. metadata : Object An object in which you may set the following attributes:
css : String A CSS class name to add to the cell's TD element. attr : String An HTML attribute definition string to apply to the data container element within the table cell (e.g. 'style="color:red;"').
record : Ext.data.record The Ext.data.Record from which the data was extracted. rowIndex : Number Row index colIndex : Number Column index store : Ext.data.Store The Ext.data.Store object from which the Record was extracted. Returns: void

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ColumnBase.ColumnID
member.summary:
(optional) Defaults to the column's initial ordinal position. A name which identifies this column. The id is used to create a CSS class name which is applied to all table cells (including headers) in that column. The class name takes the form of
x-grid3-td-id
Header cells will also recieve this class name, but will also have the class x-grid3-hd, so to target header cells, use CSS selectors such as:
.x-grid3-hd.x-grid3-td-id
The AutoExpandColumn grid config option references the column via this identifier.

member.summary: (optional) Set the CSS text-align property of the column. Defaults to undefined.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.ColumnBase.Builder`2.Css(System.String)
member.summary: (optional) Set custom CSS for all table cells in the column (excluding headers). Defaults to undefined.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.ColumnBase.Builder`2.DataIndex(System.String)
member.summary: (optional) The name of the field in the grid's Ext.data.Store's Ext.data.Record definition from which to draw the column's value. If not specified, the column's index is used as an index into the Record's data Array.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.ColumnBase.Builder`2.Fixed(System.Boolean)
member.summary: (optional) True if the column width cannot be changed. Defaults to false.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.ColumnBase.Builder`2.Header(System.String)
member.summary: The header text to display in the Grid view.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.ColumnBase.Builder`2.Hidden(System.Boolean)
member.summary: (optional) True to hide the column. Defaults to false.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.ColumnBase.Builder`2.Hideable(System.Boolean)
member.summary: (optional) Specify as false to prevent the user from hiding this column. Defaults to true.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.ColumnBase.Builder`2.ColumnID(System.String)
member.summary: (optional) Defaults to the column's initial ordinal position. A name which identifies this column. The id is used to create a CSS class name which is applied to all table cells (including headers) in that column.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.ColumnBase.Builder`2.MenuDisabled(System.Boolean)
member.summary: (optional) True to disable the column menu. Defaults to false.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.ColumnBase.Builder`2.Renderer(Ext.Net.Renderer)
member.summary: (optional) A function used to generate HTML markup for a cell given the cell's data value. If not specified, the default renderer uses the raw data value.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.ColumnBase.Builder`2.GroupRenderer(Ext.Net.Renderer)
member.summary: (optional) A function used to generate HTML markup for a cell given the cell's data value.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.ColumnBase.Builder`2.Groupable(System.Boolean)
member.summary: (optional) False to disable grouping by this column. Defaults to true.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.ColumnBase.Builder`2.Resizable(System.Boolean)
member.summary: (optional) False to disable column resizing. Defaults to true.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.ColumnBase.Builder`2.Scope(System.String)
member.summary: The scope (this reference) in which to execute the renderer. Defaults to the Column configuration object.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.ColumnBase.Builder`2.Sortable(System.Boolean)
member.summary: (optional) True if sorting is to be allowed on this column. Defaults to the value of the defaultSortable property. Whether local/remote sorting is used is specified in Ext.data.Store.remoteSort.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.ColumnBase.Builder`2.Tooltip(System.String)
member.summary: (optional) A text string to use as the column header's tooltip. If Quicktips are enabled, this value will be used as the text of the quick tip, otherwise it will be set as the header's HTML title attribute. Defaults to ''.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.ColumnBase.Builder`2.Width(System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit)
member.summary: (optional) The initial width in pixels of the column. Using this instead of Ext.grid.Grid.autoSizeColumns is more efficient.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.ColumnBase.Builder`2.Editable(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Optional. Defaults to true, enabling the configured editor. Set to false to initially disable editing on this column.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.ColumnBase.Builder`2.EmptyGroupText(System.String)
member.summary: Optional. If the grid is being rendered by an Ext.grid.GroupingView, this option may be used to specify the text to display when there is an empty group value. Defaults to the Ext.grid.GroupingView.emptyGroupText.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.ColumnBase.Builder`2.GroupName(System.String)
member.summary: Optional. If the grid is being rendered by an Ext.grid.GroupingView, this option may be used to specify the text with which to prefix the group field value in the group header line. See also groupRenderer and Ext.grid.GroupingView.showGroupName.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.Component.Bubble(System.String)
member.summary: Bubbles up the component/container heirarchy, calling the specified function with each component. The scope (this) of function call will be the scope provided or the current component. The arguments to the function will be the args provided or the current component. If the function returns false at any point, the bubble is stopped.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.Anchor
member.summary:
This configuation option is to be applied to child items of a container managed by this layout (ie. configured with layout:'anchor'). This value is what tells the layout how an item should be anchored to the container. items added to an AnchorLayout accept an anchoring-specific config property of anchor which is a string containing two values: the horizontal anchor value and the vertical anchor value (for example, '100% 50%').
The following types of anchor values are supported: Percentage : Any value between 1 and 100, expressed as a percentage. The first anchor is the percentage width that the item should take up within the container, and the second is the percentage height. For example: // two values specified anchor: '100% 50%' // render item complete width of the container and // 1/2 height of the container
// one value specified
anchor: '100%' // the width value; the height will default to auto
Offsets : Any positive or negative integer value. This is a raw adjustment where the first anchor is the offset from the right edge of the container, and the second is the offset from the bottom edge. For example: // two values specified
anchor: '-50 -100' // render item the complete width of the container // minus 50 pixels and // the complete height minus 100 pixels.
// one value specified
anchor: '-50' // anchor value is assumed to be the right offset value // bottom offset will default to 0
Sides : Valid values are 'right' (or 'r') and 'bottom' (or 'b'). Either the container must have a fixed size or an anchorSize config value defined at render time in order for these to have any effect.
Mixed : Anchor values can also be mixed as needed. For example, to render the width offset from the container right edge by 50 pixels and 75% of the container's height use: anchor: '-50 75%'

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.DefaultAnchor
member.new: Added new .DefaultAnchor property to Component. The .DefaultAnchor is applied as the .Anchor config item to all child Items during render.
member.summary: The DefaultAnchor is applied as the Anchor config item to all child Items during render.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.ColumnWidth
member.summary: The ColumnWidth property is only used with ColumnLayout is used. The ColumnWidth property is always evaluated as a percentage, and must be a decimal value greater than 0 and less than 1.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.IsFormField
member.summary: True if component should be rendered as a Form Field with a Field Label and Label separator (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.LabelSeparator
member.summary: The separator to display after the text of each fieldLabel. This property may be configured at various levels.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.LabelStyle
member.summary: A CSS style specification string to apply directly to this field's label. Defaults to the container's labelStyle value if set (eg, Ext.layout.FormLayout.labelStyle , or '').

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.HideLabels
member.summary: True to hide field labels by default (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.LabelAlign
member.summary: The default label alignment. The default value is empty string '' for left alignment, but specifying 'top' will align the labels above the fields.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.LabelWidth
member.summary: The default width in pixels of field labels (defaults to 100).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.LabelPad
member.summary: The default padding in pixels for field labels (defaults to 5). labelPad only applies if labelWidth is also specified, otherwise it will be ignored.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.Flex
member.summary: NOTE: This property is only used when the parent Layout is HBoxLayout or VBoxLayout. This configuation option is to be applied to child items of the container managed by this layout. Each child item with a flex property will be flexed horizontally according to each item's relative flex value compared to the sum of all items with a flex value specified. Any child items that have either a flex = 0 or flex = undefined will not be 'flexed' (the initial size will not be changed).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.RowHeight
member.summary: The ColumnWidth property is always evaluated as a percentage, and must be a decimal value greater than 0 and less than or equal to 1.0.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.AllowDomMove
member.summary: Whether the component can move the Dom node when rendering (defaults to true).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.ApplyTo
member.summary: Specify the id of the element, a DOM element or an existing Element corresponding to a DIV that is already present in the document that specifies some structural markup for this component.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.AutoEl
member.summary: A tag name or DomHelper spec used to create the Element which will encapsulate this Component.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.AutoShow

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.ClearCls
member.summary: The CSS class used to to apply to the special clearing div rendered directly after each form field wrapper to provide field clearing (defaults to 'x-form-clear-left').

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.Cls

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.CtCls

member.summary: Render this component disabled (default is false).

member.summary: Render this component disabled (default is false).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.HideLabel
member.summary: true to completely hide the label element (label and separator). Defaults to false. By default, even if you do not specify a fieldLabel the space will still be reserved so that the field will line up with other fields that do have labels. Setting this to true will cause the field to not reserve that space.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.HideMode
member.summary: How this component should be hidden. Supported values are 'visibility' (css visibility), 'offsets' (negative offset position) and 'display' (css display).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.HideParent
member.summary: True to hide and show the component's container when hide/show is called on the component, false to hide and show the component itself (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.ItemCls
member.summary: An additional CSS class to apply to the div wrapping the form item element of this field.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.OverCls
member.summary: An optional extra CSS class that will be added to this component's Element when the mouse moves over the Element, and removed when the mouse moves out. (defaults to '').

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.PType
member.summary: The registered ptype to create. This config option is not used when passing a config object into a constructor. This config option is used only when lazy instantiation is being used, and a Plugin is being specified not as a fully instantiated Component, but as a Component config object. The ptype will be looked up at render time up to determine what type of Plugin to create.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.Ref
member.summary: A path specification, relative to the Component's ownerCt specifying into which ancestor Container to place a named reference to this Component. The ancestor axis can be traversed by using '/' characters in the path.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.RenderTo
member.summary: The id of the node, a DOM node or an existing Element that will be the content Container to render this component into.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.StateEvents
member.summary: An array of events that, when fired, should trigger this component to save its state (defaults to none). These can be any types of events supported by this component, including browser or custom events (e.g., ['click', 'customerchange']).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.StateID
member.summary: The unique id for this component to use for state management purposes (defaults to the component id).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.Stateful
member.summary: A flag which causes the Component to attempt to restore the state of internal properties from a saved state on startup.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.StyleSpec
member.summary: A custom style specification to be applied to this component's Element.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.Plugins
member.summary: An object or array of controls that inherit from IPlugin that will provide custom functionality for this component. The only requirement for a valid plugin is that it contain an init method that accepts a reference of type Ext.Component. When a component is created, if any plugins are available, the component will call the init method on each plugin, passing a reference to itself. Each plugin can then call methods or respond to events on the component as needed to provide its functionality.

The scope (this) of function call will be the scope provided or the current component. The arguments to the function will be the args provided or the current component. If the function returns false at any point, the bubble is stopped.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.Config.Anchor
member.summary: This config is only used when this Component is rendered by a Container which has been configured to use an AnchorLayout based layout manager

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.Config.DefaultAnchor
member.summary: The DefaultAnchor is applied as the Anchor config item to all child Items during render.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.Config.AnchorHorizontal
member.summary: See Anchor property

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.Config.AnchorVertical
member.summary: See Anchor property

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.Config.ColumnWidth
member.summary: The ColumnWidth property is only used with ColumnLayout is used. The ColumnWidth property is always evaluated as a percentage, and must be a decimal value greater than 0 and less than 1.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.Config.IsFormField
member.summary: True if component should be rendered as a Form Field with a Field Label and Label separator (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.Config.LabelSeparator
member.summary: The separator to display after the text of each fieldLabel. This property may be configured at various levels.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.Config.LabelStyle
member.summary: A CSS style specification string to apply directly to this field's label. Defaults to the container's labelStyle value if set (eg, Ext.layout.FormLayout.labelStyle , or '').

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.Config.HideLabels
member.summary: True to hide field labels by default (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.Config.LabelAlign
member.summary: The default label alignment. The default value is empty string '' for left alignment, but specifying 'top' will align the labels above the fields.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.Config.LabelWidth
member.summary: The default width in pixels of field labels (defaults to 100).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.Config.LabelPad
member.summary: The default padding in pixels for field labels (defaults to 5). labelPad only applies if labelWidth is also specified, otherwise it will be ignored.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.Config.Flex
member.summary: NOTE: This property is only used when the parent Layout is HBoxLayout or VBoxLayout. This configuation option is to be applied to child items of the container managed by this layout. Each child item with a flex property will be flexed horizontally according to each item's relative flex value compared to the sum of all items with a flex value specified. Any child items that have either a flex = 0 or flex = undefined will not be 'flexed' (the initial size will not be changed).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.Config.RowHeight
member.summary: The ColumnWidth property is always evaluated as a percentage, and must be a decimal value greater than 0 and less than or equal to 1.0.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.Config.AllowDomMove
member.summary: Whether the component can move the Dom node when rendering (defaults to true).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.Config.ApplyTo
member.summary: Specify the id of the element, a DOM element or an existing Element corresponding to a DIV that is already present in the document that specifies some structural markup for this component.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.Config.AutoEl
member.summary: A tag name or DomHelper spec used to create the Element which will encapsulate this Component.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.Config.AutoShow
member.summary: True if the component should check for hidden classes (e.g. 'x-hidden' or 'x-hide-display') and remove them on render (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.Config.ClearCls
member.summary: The CSS class used to to apply to the special clearing div rendered directly after each form field wrapper to provide field clearing (defaults to 'x-form-clear-left').

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.Config.Cls
member.summary: An optional extra CSS class that will be added to this component's Element (defaults to ''). This can be useful for adding customized styles to the component or any of its children using standard CSS rules.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.Config.CtCls
member.summary: An optional extra CSS class that will be added to this component's container. This can be useful for adding customized styles to the container or any of its children using standard CSS rules.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.Config.Disabled
member.summary: Render this component disabled (default is false).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.Config.Selectable
member.summary: Determines if this component is selectable. (default is true).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.Config.DisabledClass
member.summary: CSS class added to the component when it is disabled (defaults to 'x-item-disabled').

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.Config.FieldLabel
member.summary: The label text to display next to this Component (defaults to '').

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.Config.Hidden
member.summary: Render this component hidden (default is false). If true, the hide method will be called internally.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.Config.HideLabel
member.summary: true to completely hide the label element (label and separator). Defaults to false. By default, even if you do not specify a fieldLabel the space will still be reserved so that the field will line up with other fields that do have labels. Setting this to true will cause the field to not reserve that space.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.Config.HideMode
member.summary: How this component should be hidden. Supported values are 'visibility' (css visibility), 'offsets' (negative offset position) and 'display' (css display).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.Config.HideParent
member.summary: True to hide and show the component's container when hide/show is called on the component, false to hide and show the component itself (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.Config.ItemCls
member.summary: An additional CSS class to apply to the div wrapping the form item element of this field.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.Config.OverCls
member.summary: An optional extra CSS class that will be added to this component's Element when the mouse moves over the Element, and removed when the mouse moves out. (defaults to '').

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.Config.PType
member.summary: The registered ptype to create. This config option is not used when passing a config object into a constructor. This config option is used only when lazy instantiation is being used, and a Plugin is being specified not as a fully instantiated Component, but as a Component config object. The ptype will be looked up at render time up to determine what type of Plugin to create.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.Config.Ref
member.summary: A path specification, relative to the Component's ownerCt specifying into which ancestor Container to place a named reference to this Component. The ancestor axis can be traversed by using '/' characters in the path.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.Config.RenderTo
member.summary: The id of the node, a DOM node or an existing Element that will be the content Container to render this component into.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.Config.StateEvents
member.summary: An array of events that, when fired, should trigger this component to save its state (defaults to none). These can be any types of events supported by this component, including browser or custom events (e.g., ['click', 'customerchange']).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.Config.StateID
member.summary: The unique id for this component to use for state management purposes (defaults to the component id).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.Config.Stateful
member.summary: A flag which causes the Component to attempt to restore the state of internal properties from a saved state on startup.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.Config.StyleSpec
member.summary: A custom style specification to be applied to this component's Element.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.Config.Plugins
member.summary: An object or array of controls that inherit from IPlugin that will provide custom functionality for this component. The only requirement for a valid plugin is that it contain an init method that accepts a reference of type Ext.Component. When a component is created, if any plugins are available, the component will call the init method on each plugin, passing a reference to itself. Each plugin can then call methods or respond to events on the component as needed to provide its functionality.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.Config.AutoRender
member.summary: Automatically render control on client during page load. Default is true.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.Config.ToolTips
member.summary: A collection of ToolTip configs used to add ToolTips to the Component

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.Config.AutoFocus
member.summary: True to automatically set the focus after render (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Component.Config.AutoFocusDelay
member.summary: Focus delay (in milliseconds) when AutoFocus is true.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.BoxComponentBase.AutoScroll
member.summary: true to use overflow:'auto' on the components layout element and show scroll bars automatically when necessary, false to clip any overflowing content (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.BoxComponentBase.AutoHeight
member.summary: True to use height:'auto', false to use fixed height (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.BoxComponentBase.AutoWidth
member.summary: True to use width:'auto', false to use fixed width (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.BoxComponentBase.CollapseMode
member.summary: By default, collapsible regions are collapsed by clicking the expand/collapse tool button that renders into the region's title bar. Optionally, when collapseMode is set to 'mini' the region's split bar will also display a small collapse button in the center of the bar. In 'mini' mode the region will collapse to a thinner bar than in normal mode. By default collapseMode is undefined, and the only two supported values are undefined and 'mini'. Note that if a collapsible region does not have a title bar, then collapseMode must be set to 'mini' in order for the region to be collapsible by the user as the tool button will not be rendered.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.BoxComponentBase.Builder`2.CollapseMode(Ext.Net.CollapseMode)
member.summary: By default, collapsible regions are collapsed by clicking the expand/collapse tool button that renders into the region's title bar. Optionally, when collapseMode is set to 'mini' the region's split bar will also display a small collapse button in the center of the bar. In 'mini' mode the region will collapse to a thinner bar than in normal mode. By default collapseMode is undefined, and the only two supported values are undefined and 'mini'. Note that if a collapsible region does not have a title bar, then collapseMode must be set to 'mini' in order for the region to be collapsible by the user as the tool button will not be rendered.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.BoxComponentBase.Builder`2.Split(System.Boolean)
member.summary: True to create a SplitRegion and display a 5px wide Ext.SplitBar between this region and its neighbor, allowing the user to resize the regions dynamically. Defaults to false creating a Region. Note: this config is only used when this BoxComponent is rendered by a Container which has been configured to use the BorderLayout layout manager (e.g. specifying layout:'border').

member.name: M:Ext.Net.ContainerBase.Add(Ext.Net.Component)
member.summary: Adds a component to this container. Fires the beforeadd event before adding, then fires the add event after the component has been added. If the container is already rendered when add is called, you may need to call doLayout to refresh the view. This is required so that you can add multiple child components if needed while only refreshing the layout once.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.ContainerBase.Add(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Ext.Net.Component})
member.summary: Adds a range of components to this container.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.ContainerBase.Cascade(System.String)
member.summary: Cascades down the component/container heirarchy from this component (called first), calling the specified function with each component. The scope (this) of function call will be the scope provided or the current component. The arguments to the function will be the args provided or the current component. If the function returns false at any point, the cascade is stopped on that branch.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.ContainerBase.Cascade(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Cascades down the component/container heirarchy from this component (called first), calling the specified function with each component. The scope (this) of function call will be the scope provided or the current component. The arguments to the function will be the args provided or the current component. If the function returns false at any point, the cascade is stopped on that branch.

If the function returns false at any point, the cascade is stopped on that branch.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ContainerBase.ActiveItem
member.summary: A string component id or the numeric index of the component that should be initially activated within the content Container's layout on render.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ContainerBase.ActiveIndex
member.summary: A string component id or the numeric index of the component that should be initially activated within the content Container's layout on render.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ContainerBase.AutoDestroy
member.summary: If true the content Container will automatically destroy any contained component that is removed from it, else destruction must be handled manually (defaults to true).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ContainerBase.AutoDoLayout
member.new: Added new AutoDoLayout property to Container. If .AutoDoLayout is true, the .doLayout() function will be called in the afterrender event. Default is false.
member.summary: If true .doLayout() is called after render. Default is false.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ContainerBase.BufferResize
member.summary: When set to true (50 milliseconds) or a number of milliseconds, the layout assigned for this container will buffer the frequency it calculates and does a re-layout of components. This is useful for heavy containers or containers with a large quantity of sub-components for which frequent layout calls would be expensive. Defaults to 50.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ContainerBase.DefaultType
member.summary: The default type of content Container represented by this object as registered in Ext.ComponentMgr (defaults to 'panel').

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ContainerBase.Defaults
member.summary: A config object that will be applied to all components added to this content Container either via the items config or via the add or insert methods. The defaults config can contain any number of name/value property pairs to be added to each items, and should be valid for the types of items being added to the content Container. For example, to automatically apply padding to the body of each of a set of contained Ext.Panel items, you could pass: defaults: {bodyStyle:'padding:15px'}.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ContainerBase.HideBorders
member.summary: True to hide the borders of each contained component, false to defer to the component's existing border settings (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ContainerBase.MonitorResize
member.summary: True to automatically monitor window resize events to handle anything that is sensitive to the current size of the viewport. This value is typically managed by the chosen layout and should not need to be set manually.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ContainerBase.ForceLayout
member.summary: If true the container will force a layout initially even if hidden or collapsed. This option is useful for forcing forms to render in collapsed or hidden containers. (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.MenuBase.EnableScrolling
member.summary: Whenever a menu gets so long that the items won't fit the viewable area, it provides the user with an easy UI to scroll the menu.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.MenuBase.Floating
member.summary: By default, a Menu configured as floating:true will be rendered as an Ext.Layer (an absolutely positioned, floating Component with zindex=15000). If configured as floating:false, the Menu may be used as child item of another Container instead of a free-floating Layer.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.MenuBase.AllowOtherMenus
member.summary: True to allow multiple menus to be displayed at the same time (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.MenuBase.DefaultAlign
member.summary: The default Ext.Element.alignTo anchor position value for this menu relative to its element of origin (defaults to \"tl-bl?\")

member.name: P:Ext.Net.MenuBase.OffsetX
member.summary: X offset in pixels by which to change the default Menu popup position after aligning according to the defaultAlign configuration.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.MenuBase.OffsetY
member.summary: Y offset in pixels by which to change the default Menu popup position after aligning according to the defaultAlign configuration.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.MenuBase.IgnoreParentClicks
member.summary: True to ignore clicks on any item in this menu that is a parent item (displays a submenu) so that the submenu is not dismissed when clicking the parent item (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.MenuBase.MinWidth
member.summary: The minimum width of the menu in pixels (defaults to 120).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.MenuBase.MaxHeight
member.summary: The maximum height of the menu. Only applies when enableScrolling is set to True (defaults to null).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.MenuBase.ScrollIncrement
member.summary: The amount to scroll the menu. Only applies when enableScrolling is set to True (defaults to 24).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.MenuBase.ShowSeparator
member.summary: True to show the icon separator. (defaults to true).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.MenuBase.Shadow
member.summary: True or \"sides\" for the default effect, \"frame\" for 4-way shadow, and \"drop\" for bottom-right shadow (defaults to \"sides\")

member.name: P:Ext.Net.MenuBase.SubMenuAlign

member.summary: By default, a Menu configured as floating:true will be rendered as an Ext.Layer (an absolutely positioned, floating Component with zindex=15000). If configured as floating:false, the Menu may be used as child item of another Container instead of a free-floating Layer.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.PanelBase.AutoLoad
member.summary: A valid url spec according to the UpdateOptions Ext.UpdateOptions.update method. If autoLoad is not null, the panel will attempt to load its contents immediately upon render. The URL will become the default URL for this panel's body element, so it may be refreshed at any time.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.PanelBase.BaseCls
member.summary: The base CSS class to apply to this panel's element (defaults to 'x-panel').

member.name: P:Ext.Net.PanelBase.BottomBar
member.summary: The bottom toolbar of the panel. This can be a Ext.Toolbar object, a toolbar config, or an array of buttons/button configs to be added to the toolbar.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.PanelBase.Closable
member.summary: True to display the 'close' button and allow the user to close the tab, false to hide the button and disallow closing the tab (default to false).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.PanelBase.CloseAction
member.summary: The action to take when the Panel is closed. The default action is 'close' which will actually remove the Panel from the DOM and destroy it. The other valid option is 'hide' which will simply hide the Panel by setting visibility to hidden and applying negative offsets, keeping the Panel available to be redisplayed via the show method.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.PanelBase.TopBar
member.summary: The top toolbar of the panel. This can be a Ext.Toolbar object, a toolbar config, or an array of buttons/button configs to be added to the toolbar.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.PanelBase.FooterBar
member.summary: A Toolbar object, a Toolbar config, or an array of Buttons/Button configs, describing a Toolbar to be rendered into this Panel's footer element.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.PanelBase.FormGroup
member.summary: True to animate the transition when the panel is collapsed, false to skip the animation (defaults to true if the Ext.Fx class is available, otherwise false).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.PanelBase.BodyBorder
member.summary: True to display an interior border on the body element of the panel, false to hide it (defaults to true). This only applies when border == true. If border == true and bodyBorder == false, the border will display as a 1px wide inset border, giving the entire body element an inset appearance.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.PanelBase.BodyCssClass
member.summary: Additional css class selector to be applied to the body element

member.name: P:Ext.Net.PanelBase.BodyStyle
member.summary: Custom CSS styles to be applied to the body element in the format expected by Ext.Element.applyStyles (defaults to null).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.PanelBase.Border
member.summary: True to display the borders of the panel's body element, false to hide them (defaults to true). By default, the border is a 2px wide inset border, but this can be further altered by setting bodyBorder to false.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.PanelBase.ButtonAlign
member.summary: Valid values are "left", "center" and "right" (defaults to "right").

member.name: P:Ext.Net.PanelBase.Buttons
member.summary: A collection of buttons configs used to add buttons to the footer of this panel

member.name: P:Ext.Net.PanelBase.CollapseFirst
member.summary: True to make sure the collapse/expand toggle button always renders first (to the left of) any other tools in the panel's title bar, false to render it last (defaults to true).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.PanelBase.Collapsed
member.summary: True to render the panel collapsed, false to render it expanded (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.PanelBase.CollapsedCls
member.summary: A CSS class to add to the panel's element after it has been collapsed (defaults to 'x-panel-collapsed').

member.name: P:Ext.Net.PanelBase.Collapsible
member.summary: True to make the panel collapsible and have the expand/collapse toggle button automatically rendered into the header tool button area, false to keep the panel statically sized with no button (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.PanelBase.Draggable
member.summary: True to enable dragging of this Panel (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.PanelBase.DraggableConfig
member.summary: Drag config object.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.PanelBase.Elements
member.summary: A comma-delimited list of panel elements to initialize when the panel is rendered.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.PanelBase.Floating
member.summary: True to float the panel (absolute position it with automatic shimming and shadow), false to display it inline where it is rendered (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.PanelBase.Footer
member.summary: True to create the footer element explicitly, false to skip creating it. By default, when footer is not specified, if one or more buttons have been added to the panel the footer will be created automatically, otherwise it will not.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.PanelBase.Frame
member.summary: True to render the panel with custom rounded borders, false to render with plain 1px square borders (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.PanelBase.Header
member.summary: True to create the header element explicitly, false to skip creating it. By default, when header is not specified, if a title is set the header will be created automatically, otherwise it will not. If a title is set but header is explicitly set to false, the header will not be rendered.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.PanelBase.HeaderAsText
member.summary: True to display the panel title in the header, false to hide it (defaults to true).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.PanelBase.HideCollapseTool
member.summary: True to hide the expand/collapse toggle button when collapsible = true, false to display it (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.PanelBase.Html
member.summary: An HTML fragment, or a DomHelper specification to use as the panel's body content (defaults to '').

member.name: P:Ext.Net.PanelBase.Icon
member.summary: The icon to use in the Title bar. See also, IconCls to set an icon with a custom Css class.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.PanelBase.IconCls
member.summary: A CSS class that will provide a background image to be used as the panel header icon (defaults to '').

member.name: P:Ext.Net.PanelBase.KeyMap
member.summary: A KeyMap config object (in the format expected by Ext.KeyMap.addBinding used to assign custom key handling to this panel (defaults to null).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.PanelBase.MaskDisabled
member.summary: True to mask the panel when it is disabled, false to not mask it (defaults to true). Either way, the panel will always tell its contained elements to disable themselves when it is disabled, but masking the panel can provide an additional visual cue that the panel is disabled.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.PanelBase.MinButtonWidth
member.summary: Minimum width in pixels of all buttons in this panel (defaults to 75).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.PanelBase.Shadow
member.summary: ShadowMode to display a shadow behind the panel. Note that this option only applies when floating = true.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.PanelBase.ShadowOffset
member.summary: The number of pixels to offset the shadow if displayed (defaults to 4). Note that this option only applies when floating = true.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.PanelBase.Shim
member.summary: False to disable the iframe shim in browsers which need one (defaults to true). Note that this option only applies when floating = true.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.PanelBase.Padding
member.summary: A shortcut for setting a padding style on the body element. The value can either be a number to be applied to all sides, or a normal css string describing padding. See also, PaddingSummary.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.PanelBase.PaddingSummary
member.summary: A shortcut for setting a padding style on the body element. The value can either be a number to be applied to all sides, or a normal css string describing padding. See also, Padding.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.PanelBase.LoadMask
member.summary: An Ext.LoadMask to mask the Panel while loading (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.PanelBase.Title
member.summary: The title text to display in the panel header (defaults to ''). When a title is specified the header element will automatically be created and displayed unless header is explicitly set to false. If you don't want to specify a title at config time, but you may want one later, you must either specify a non-empty title (a blank space ' ' will do) or header:true so that the content Container element will get created.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.PanelBase.TitleCollapse
member.summary: True to allow expanding and collapsing the panel (when collapsible = true) by clicking anywhere in the header bar, false to allow it only by clicking to tool button (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.PanelBase.Tools
member.summary: An array of tool button configs to be added to the header tool area. When rendered, each tool is stored as an Element referenced by a public property called tools.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.PanelBase.Unstyled
member.summary: Overrides the baseCls setting to baseCls = 'x-plain' which renders the panel unstyled except for required attributes for Ext layouts to function (e.g. overflow:hidden).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.PanelBase.PreventBodyReset
member.summary: Defaults to false. When set to true, an extra css class 'x-panel-normal' will be added to the panel's element, effectively applying css styles suggested by the W3C (see http://www.w3.org/TR/CSS21/sample.html) to the Panel's body element (not the header, footer, etc.).

member.name: M:Ext.Net.PanelBase.Builder`2.AnimCollapse(System.Boolean)
member.summary: True to animate the transition when the panel is collapsed, false to skip the animation (defaults to true if the Ext.Fx class is available, otherwise false).

member.summary: The base CSS class to apply to this panel's element (defaults to 'x-panel').

member.name: M:Ext.Net.PanelBase.Builder`2.Closable(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Panels themselves do not directly support being closed, but some Panel subclasses do (like Ext.Window) or a Panel Class within an Ext.TabPanel. Specify true to enable closing in such situations. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.PanelBase.Config.PaddingSummary
member.summary: A shortcut for setting a padding style on the body element. The value can either be a number to be applied to all sides, or a normal css string describing padding. See also, Padding.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.PanelBase.Config.LoadMask
member.summary: An Ext.LoadMask to mask the Panel while loading (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.PanelBase.Config.Title
member.summary: The title text to display in the panel header (defaults to ''). When a title is specified the header element will automatically be created and displayed unless header is explicitly set to false. If you don't want to specify a title at config time, but you may want one later, you must either specify a non-empty title (a blank space ' ' will do) or header:true so that the content Container element will get created.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.PanelBase.Config.TitleCollapse
member.summary: True to allow expanding and collapsing the panel (when collapsible = true) by clicking anywhere in the header bar, false to allow it only by clicking to tool button (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.PanelBase.Config.Tools
member.summary: An array of tool button configs to be added to the header tool area. When rendered, each tool is stored as an Element referenced by a public property called tools.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.PanelBase.Config.Unstyled
member.summary: Overrides the baseCls setting to baseCls = 'x-plain' which renders the panel unstyled except for required attributes for Ext layouts to function (e.g. overflow:hidden).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.PanelBase.Config.PreventBodyReset
member.summary: Defaults to false. When set to true, an extra css class 'x-panel-normal' will be added to the panel's element, effectively applying css styles suggested by the W3C (see http://www.w3.org/TR/CSS21/sample.html) to the Panel's body element (not the header, footer, etc.).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.TabPanelBase.ActiveTab
member.summary: The numeric index of the tab that should be initially activated on render.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.TabPanelBase.ActiveTabIndex
member.summary: The numeric index of the tab that should be initially activated on render.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.TabPanelBase.AnimScroll
member.summary: True to animate tab scrolling so that hidden tabs slide smoothly into view (defaults to true). Only applies when EnableTabScroll = true.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.TabPanelBase.AutoTabSelector
member.summary: The CSS selector used to search for tabs in existing markup when autoTabs = true (defaults to 'div.x-tab'). This can be any valid selector supported by Ext.DomQuery.select. Note that the query will be executed within the scope of this tab panel only (so that multiple tab panels from markup can be supported on a page).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.TabPanelBase.AutoTabs
member.summary: true to query the DOM for any divs with a class of 'x-tab' to be automatically converted to tabs and added to this panel (defaults to false). Note that the query will be executed within the scope of the container element only (so that multiple tab panels from markup can be supported via this method).
member.remarks: This method is only possible when the markup is structured correctly as a container with nested divs containing the class 'x-tab'. To create TabPanels without these limitations, or to pull tab content from other elements on the page, see the example at the top of the class for generating tabs from markup. There are a couple of things to note when using this method: When using the autoTabs config (as opposed to passing individual tab configs in the TabPanel's items collection), you must use applyTo to correctly use the specified id as the tab container. The autoTabs method replaces existing content with the TabPanel components. Make sure that you set deferredRender: false so that the content elements for each tab will be rendered into the TabPanel immediately upon page load, otherwise they will not be transformed until each tab is activated and will be visible outside the TabPanel.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.TabPanelBase.BaseCls
member.summary: The base CSS class applied to the panel (defaults to 'x-tab-panel').

member.name: P:Ext.Net.TabPanelBase.DeferredRender
member.summary: Determining whether or not each tab is rendered only when first accessed (defaults to true).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.TabPanelBase.EnableTabScroll
member.summary: True to enable scrolling to tabs that may be invisible due to overflowing the overall TabPanel width. Only available with tabs on addToStart. (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.TabPanelBase.LayoutOnTabChange
member.summary: Set to true to do a layout of tab items as tabs are changed.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.TabPanelBase.MinTabWidth
member.summary: The minimum width in pixels for each tab when ResizeTabs = true (defaults to 30).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.TabPanelBase.Plain
member.summary: True to render the tab strip without a background content Container image (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.TabPanelBase.ResizeTabs
member.summary: True to automatically resize each tab so that the tabs will completely fill the tab strip (defaults to false). Setting this to true may cause specific widths that might be set per tab to be overridden in order to fit them all into view (although MinTabWidth will always be honored).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.TabPanelBase.ScrollDuration
member.summary: The number of milliseconds that each scroll animation should last (defaults to .35). Only applies when AnimScroll = true.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.TabPanelBase.ScrollIncrement
member.summary: The number of pixels to scroll each time a tab scroll button is pressed (defaults to 100, or if ResizeTabs = true, the calculated tab width). Only applies when EnableTabScroll = true.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.TabPanelBase.ScrollRepeatInterval
member.summary: Number of milliseconds between each scroll while a tab scroll button is continuously pressed (defaults to 400).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.TabPanelBase.TabMargin
member.summary: The number of pixels of space to calculate into the sizing and scrolling of tabs. If you change the margin in CSS, you will need to update this value so calculations are correct with either resizeTabs or scrolling tabs. (defaults to 2)

member.name: P:Ext.Net.TabPanelBase.TabAlign
member.summary: The alignment of the Tabs (defaults to 'Left'). Other option includes 'Right'. Note that tab scrolling is only supported for TabAlign='Left'. Note that when 'Right', the Tabs will be rendered in reverse order.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.TabPanelBase.TabCls
member.summary: This config option is used on child Components of ths TabPanel. A CSS class name applied to the tab strip item representing the child Component, allowing special styling to be applied.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.TabPanelBase.TabPosition
member.summary: The position where the tab strip should be rendered (defaults to 'addToStart'). The only other supported value is 'Bottom'. Note that tab scrolling is only supported for position 'addToStart'.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.TabPanelBase.TabWidth
member.summary: The initial width in pixels of each new tab (defaults to 120).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.TabPanelBase.WheelIncrement
member.summary: For scrolling tabs, the number of pixels to increment on mouse wheel scrolling (defaults to 20).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.TabPanelBase.DefaultTabMenu
member.summary: Default menu for all tabs

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the control state automatically posts back to the server when tab changed.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether validation is performed when the control is set to validate when a postback occurs.

member.name: T:Ext.Net.StatusBarStatusConfig
member.summary: A config object containing any or all of the following properties. If this object is not specified the status will be cleared using the defaults.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.StatusBarStatusConfig.Text
member.summary: The status text to display. If not specified, any current status text will remain unchanged.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.StatusBarStatusConfig.Icon
member.summary: An Icon that will be applied to the status element and is expected to provide a background image that will serve as the status bar icon (defaults to 'Icon.None'). The Icons is applied directly to the div that also contains the status text, so the rule should provide the appropriate padding on the div to make room for the image.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.StatusBarStatusConfig.IconCls
member.summary: The CSS class used to customize the status icon (see iconCls for details). If not specified, any current iconCls will remain unchanged.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.StatusBarStatusConfig.ClearIcon
member.summary: True to clear icon

member.name: P:Ext.Net.StatusBarStatusConfig.Clear
member.summary: Allows you to set an internal callback that will automatically clear the status text and iconCls after a specified amount of time has passed. If clear is not specified, the new status will not be auto-cleared and will stay until updated again or cleared using clearStatus.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.StatusBarStatusConfig.Clear2
member.summary: If true is passed, the status will be cleared using autoClear, defaultText and defaultIconCls via a fade out animation.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.StatusBarStatusConfig.Clear3
member.summary: If a numeric value is passed, it will be used as the callback interval (in milliseconds), overriding the autoClear value.

member.name: T:Ext.Net.ScriptTagProxy
member.summary:
An implementation of DataProxy that reads a data object from a URL which may be in a domain other than the originating domain of the running page.
Note that if you are retrieving data from a page that is in a domain that is NOT the same as the originating domain of the running page, you must use this class, rather than HttpProxy.
The content passed back from a server resource requested by a ScriptTagProxy must be executable JavaScript source code because it is used as the source inside a <script> tag.
In order for the browser to process the returned data, the server must wrap the data object with a call to a callback function, the name of which is passed as a parameter by the ScriptTagProxy. Below is a Java example for a servlet which returns data for either a ScriptTagProxy, or an HttpProxy depending on whether the callback name was passed:

member.name: T:Ext.Net.DataProxy
member.summary: This class is an abstract base class for implementations which provide retrieval of unformatted data objects.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DataProxy.Listeners
member.summary: Client-side JavaScript Event Handlers

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DataProxy.RestAPI
member.summary: Specific urls to call on REST action methods "read", "create", "update" and "destroy".

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DataProxy.Config.Listeners
member.summary: Client-side JavaScript Event Handlers

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ScriptTagProxy.CallbackParam
member.summary: (Optional) The name of the parameter to pass to the server which tells the server the name of the callback function set up by the load call to process the returned data object. Defaults to "callback". The server-side processing must read this parameter value, and generate javascript output which calls this named function passing the data object as its only parameter.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ScriptTagProxy.NoCache
member.summary: (optional) Defaults to true. Disable caching by adding a unique parameter name to the request.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ScriptTagProxy.Timeout
member.summary: (optional) The number of milliseconds to wait for a response. Defaults to 30 seconds.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ScriptTagProxy.Url

member.name: P:Ext.Net.NotificationConfig.ShowMode
member.summary: Determines how the Notification Windows will be shown in relation to each other if more than one rendered to the viewport at a single time. Options include "Grid" which will show each individual separately in a matrix and new Notification Windows will be shown in the best available empty hole within the grid. Best available is considered bottom-right. If ShowMode.Stack, the Notification Windows will be stacked on top of each other hiding the Window below.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.NotificationConfig.CloseVisible
member.summary: True to close all other visible notifications

member.name: P:Ext.Net.NotificationConfig.Modal
member.summary: True to make the window modal and mask everything behind it when displayed, false to display it without restricting access to other UI elements (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.NotificationConfig.PinEvent
member.summary: Stop hidding event, 'none' if hidding can not be stoped

member.name: P:Ext.Net.NotificationConfig.HideDelay

member.summary: A css class which sets a background image to be used as the icon in the header.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.NotificationConfig.AutoLoad
member.summary: A valid url spec according to the UpdateOptions Ext.UpdateOptions.update method. If autoLoad is not null, the panel will attempt to load its contents immediately upon render. The URL will become the default URL for this panel's body element, so it may be refreshed at any time.

member.summary: Reconfigure columns.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.GridPanelBase.Reconfigure(System.String,Ext.Net.ColumnModel)
member.summary: Reconfigures the grid to use a different Store and Column Model and fires the 'reconfigure' event. The View will be bound to the new objects and refreshed. Be aware that upon reconfiguring a GridPanel, certain existing settings may become invalidated. For example the configured autoExpandColumn may no longer exist in the new ColumnModel. Also, an existing PagingToolbar will still be bound to the old Store, and will need rebinding. Any plugins might also need reconfiguring with the new data.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.GridPanelBase.Reconfigure(System.String)
member.summary: Reconfigures the grid to use a different Store and Column Model and fires the 'reconfigure' event. The View will be bound to the new objects and refreshed. Be aware that upon reconfiguring a GridPanel, certain existing settings may become invalidated. For example the configured autoExpandColumn may no longer exist in the new ColumnModel. Also, an existing PagingToolbar will still be bound to the old Store, and will need rebinding. Any plugins might also need reconfiguring with the new data.

member.name: T:Ext.Net.DragZone
member.summary: This class provides a container DD instance that allows dragging of multiple child source nodes. This class does not move the drag target nodes, but a proxy element which may contain any DOM structure you wish. The DOM element to show in the proxy is provided by either a provided implementation of getDragData, or by registered draggables registered with Ext.dd.Registry If you wish to provide draggability for an arbitrary number of DOM nodes, each of which represent some application object (For example nodes in a DataView) then use of this class is the most efficient way to "activate" those nodes. By default, this class requires that draggable child nodes are registered with Ext.dd.Registry. However a simpler way to allow a DragZone to manage any number of draggable elements is to configure the DragZone with an implementation of the getDragData method which interrogates the passed mouse event to see if it has taken place within an element, or class of elements. This is easily done by using the event's getTarget method to identify a node based on a Ext.DomQuery selector.

member.name: T:Ext.Net.DragSource
member.summary: A simple class that provides the basic implementation needed to make any element draggable.

member.name: T:Ext.Net.DDProxy
member.summary: A DragDrop implementation that inserts an empty, bordered div into the document that follows the cursor during drag operations. At the time of the click, the frame div is resized to the dimensions of the linked html element, and moved to the exact location of the linked element. References to the "frame" element refer to the single proxy element that was created to be dragged in place of all DDProxy elements on the page.

member.name: T:Ext.Net.DD
member.summary: A DragDrop implementation where the linked element follows the mouse cursor during a drag.

member.name: T:Ext.Net.DragDrop
member.summary: Defines the interface and base operation of items that that can be dragged or can be drop targets. It was designed to be extended, overriding the event handlers for startDrag, onDrag, onDragOver and onDragOut. Up to three html elements can be associated with a DragDrop instance: linked element: the element that is passed into the constructor. This is the element which defines the boundaries for interaction with other DragDrop objects. handle element(s): The drag operation only occurs if the element that was clicked matches a handle element. By default this is the linked element, but there are times that you will want only a portion of the linked element to initiate the drag operation, and the setHandleElId() method provides a way to define this. drag element: this represents the element that would be moved along with the cursor during a drag operation. By default, this is the linked element itself as in Ext.dd.DD. setDragElId() lets you define a separate element that would be moved, as in Ext.dd.DDProxy.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.DragDrop.AddInvalidHandleClass(System.String)
member.summary: Lets you specify a css class of elements that will not initiate a drag
member.param: the class of the elements you wish to ignore

member.name: M:Ext.Net.DragDrop.AddInvalidHandleId(System.String)
member.summary: Lets you to specify an element id for a child of a drag handle that should not initiate a drag

member.name: M:Ext.Net.DragDrop.AddInvalidHandleType(System.String)
member.summary: Allows you to specify a tag name that should not start a drag operation when clicked. This is designed to facilitate embedding links within a drag handle that do something other than start the drag.
member.param: the type of element to exclude

member.name: M:Ext.Net.DragDrop.AddToGroup(System.String)
member.summary: Add this instance to a group of related drag/drop objects. All instances belong to at least one group, and can belong to as many groups as needed.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.DragDrop.ApplyConfig
member.summary: Applies the configuration parameters that were passed into the constructor. This is supposed to happen at each level through the inheritance chain. So a DDProxy implentation will execute apply config on DDProxy, DD, and DragDrop in order to get all of the parameters that are available in each object.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.DragDrop.SetHandleElId(System.String)
member.summary: Allows you to specify a child of the linked element that should be used to initiate the drag operation. An example of this would be if you have a content div with text and links. Clicking anywhere in the content area would normally start the drag operation. Use this method to specify that an element inside of the content div is the element that starts the drag operation.
member.param: the id of the element that will be used to initiate the drag.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.DragDrop.SetPadding(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Configures the padding for the target zone in px. Effectively expands (or reduces) the virtual object size for targeting calculations. Supports css-style shorthand; if only one parameter is passed, all sides will have that padding, and if only two are passed, the top and bottom will have the first param, the left and right the second.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.DragDrop.SetXConstraint(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: By default, the element can be dragged any place on the screen. Use this method to limit the horizontal travel of the element. Pass in 0,0 for the parameters if you want to lock the drag to the y axis.
member.param: the number of pixels the element can move to the left
the number of pixels the element can move to the right
optional parameter for specifying that the element should move iTickSize pixels at a time.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.DragDrop.SetYConstraint(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: By default, the element can be dragged any place on the screen. Set this to limit the vertical travel of the element. Pass in 0,0 for the parameters if you want to lock the drag to the x axis.
member.param: the number of pixels the element can move up
the number of pixels the element can move down
optional parameter for specifying that the element should move iTickSize pixels at a time.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DragDrop.Groups
member.summary: The group defines a logical collection of DragDrop objects that are related. Instances only get events when interacting with other DragDrop object in the same group. This lets us define multiple groups using a single DragDrop subclass if we want.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DragDrop.HasOuterHandles
member.summary: By default, drags can only be initiated if the mousedown occurs in the region the linked element is. This is done in part to work around a bug in some browsers that mis-report the mousedown if the previous mouseup happened outside of the window. This property is set to true if outer handles are defined.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DD.Scroll
member.summary: When set to true, the utility automatically tries to scroll the browser window when a drag and drop element is dragged near the viewport boundary. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DDProxy.CenterFrame
member.summary: By default the frame is positioned exactly where the drag element is, so we use the cursor offset provided by Ext.dd.DD. Another option that works only if you do not have constraints on the obj is to have the drag frame centered around the cursor. Set centerFrame to true for this effect.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DDProxy.ResizeFrame
member.summary: By default we resize the drag frame to be the same size as the element we want to drag (this is to get the frame effect). We can turn it off if we want a different behavior.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DDProxy.AfterDrag
member.summary: Abstract method runs on drag end

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DragSource.Group
member.summary: A named drag drop group to which this object belongs. If a group is specified, then this object will only interact with other drag drop objects in the same group (defaults to undefined).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DragSource.DropAllowed
member.summary: The CSS class returned to the drag source when drop is allowed (defaults to "x-dd-drop-ok").

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DragSource.DropNotAllowed
member.summary: The CSS class returned to the drag source when drop is not allowed (defaults to "x-dd-drop-nodrop").

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DragSource.AfterDragDrop
member.summary: An empty function by default, but provided so that you can perform a custom action after a valid drag drop has occurred by providing an implementation. Parameters: target : The drop target e : The mouseup event id : The id of the dropped element

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DragSource.AfterDragEnter
member.summary: An empty function by default, but provided so that you can perform a custom action when the dragged item enters the drop target by providing an implementation. Parameters: target : The drop target e : The mouseup event id : The id of the dragged element

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DragSource.AfterDragOut
member.summary: An empty function by default, but provided so that you can perform a custom action after the dragged item is dragged out of the target without dropping. Parameters: target : The drop target e : The mouseup event id : The id of the dragged element

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DragSource.AfterDragOver
member.summary: An empty function by default, but provided so that you can perform a custom action while the dragged item is over the drop target by providing an implementation. Parameters: target : The drop target e : The mouseup event id : The id of the dragged element

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DragSource.AfterInvalidDrop
member.summary: An empty function by default, but provided so that you can perform a custom action after an invalid drop has occurred by providing an implementation. Parameters: e : The mouseup event id : The id of the dropped element

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DragSource.BeforeDragDrop
member.summary: An empty function by default, but provided so that you can perform a custom action before the dragged item is dropped onto the target and optionally cancel the onDragDrop. Parameters: target : The drop target e : The mouseup event id : The id of the dragged element

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DragSource.BeforeDragEnter
member.summary: An empty function by default, but provided so that you can perform a custom action before the dragged item enters the drop target and optionally cancel the onDragEnter. Parameters: target : The drop target e : The mouseup event id : The id of the dragged element

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DragSource.BeforeDragOut
member.summary: An empty function by default, but provided so that you can perform a custom action before the dragged item is dragged out of the target without dropping, and optionally cancel the onDragOut. Parameters: target : The drop target e : The mouseup event id : The id of the dragged element

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DragSource.BeforeDragOver
member.summary: An empty function by default, but provided so that you can perform a custom action while the dragged item is over the drop target and optionally cancel the onDragOver. Parameters: target : The drop target e : The mouseup event id : The id of the dragged element

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DragSource.BeforeInvalidDrop
member.summary: An empty function by default, but provided so that you can perform a custom action after an invalid drop has occurred. Parameters: target : The drop target e : The mouseup event id : The id of the dropped element

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DragSource.OnBeforeDrag
member.summary: An empty function by default, but provided so that you can perform a custom action before the initial drag event begins and optionally cancel it. Parameters: data : An object containing arbitrary data to be shared with drop targets e : The event object

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DragSource.OnStartDrag
member.summary: An empty function by default, but provided so that you can perform a custom action once the initial drag event has begun. The drag cannot be canceled from this function. Parameters: x : The x position of the click on the dragged object y : The y position of the click on the dragged object

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DragSource.GetDragData
member.summary: Returns the data object associated with this drag source

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DragZone.ContainerScroll
member.summary: True to register this container with the Scrollmanager for auto scrolling during drag operations.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DragZone.HighlightingColor
member.summary: The color to use when visually highlighting the drag source in the afterRepair method after a failed drop (defaults to "c3daf9" - light blue)

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DragZone.AfterRepair
member.summary: Called after a repair of an invalid drop. By default, highlights this.dragData.ddel

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DragZone.GetRepairXY
member.summary: Called before a repair of an invalid drop to get the XY to animate to. By default returns the XY of this.dragData.ddel Parameters: e : The mouse up event

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DragZone.OnInitDrag
member.summary: Called once drag threshold has been reached to initialize the proxy element. By default, it clones the this.dragData.ddel Parameters: x : The x position of the click on the dragged object y : The y position of the click on the dragged object

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DataViewBase.LoadingText
member.summary: A string to display during data load operations (defaults to undefined). If specified, this text will be displayed in a loading div and the view's contents will be cleared while loading, otherwise the view's contents will continue to display normally until the new data is loaded and the contents are replaced.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DataViewBase.MultiSelect

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DataViewBase.Config.ItemSelector
member.summary: This is a required setting. A simple CSS selector (e.g. div.some-class or span:first-child) that will be used to determine what nodes this DataView will be working with.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DataViewBase.Config.LoadingText
member.summary: A string to display during data load operations (defaults to undefined). If specified, this text will be displayed in a loading div and the view's contents will be cleared while loading, otherwise the view's contents will continue to display normally until the new data is loaded and the contents are replaced.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DataViewBase.Config.MultiSelect
member.summary: True to allow selection of more than one item at a time, false to allow selection of only a single item at a time or no selection at all, depending on the value of singleSelect (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DataViewBase.Config.OverClass
member.summary: A CSS class to apply to each item in the view on mouseover (defaults to undefined).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DataViewBase.Config.SelectedClass
member.summary: A CSS class to apply to each selected item in the view (defaults to 'x-view-selected').

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DataViewBase.Config.SimpleSelect
member.summary: True to enable multiselection by clicking on multiple items without requiring the user to hold Shift or Ctrl, false to force the user to hold Ctrl or Shift to select more than on item (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DataViewBase.Config.SingleSelect
member.summary: True to allow selection of exactly one item at a time, false to allow no selection at all (defaults to false). Note that if multiSelect = true, this value will be ignored.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DataProxyDirectEvents.BeforeLoad
member.summary: Fires before a network request is made to retrieve a data object.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DataProxyDirectEvents.Load
member.summary: Fires before the load method's callback is called.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DataProxyDirectEvents.LoawdException
member.summary:
Fires if an exception occurs in the Proxy during data loading. This event can be fired for one of two reasons: The load call timed out. This means the load callback did not execute within the time limit specified by timeout. In this case, this event will be raised and the fourth parameter (read error) will be null.
The load succeeded but the reader could not read the response. This means the server returned data, but the configured Reader threw an error while reading the data. In this case, this event will be raised and the caught error will be passed along as the fourth parameter of this event.
Note that this event is also relayed through Store, so you can listen for it directly on any Store instance.
DirectEvents will be called with the following arguments: this : Object
options : Object The loading options that were specified (see load for details). If the load call timed out, this parameter will be null.
arg : Object The callback's arg object passed to the load function
e : Error The JavaScript Error object caught if the configured Reader could not read the data. If the load call returned success: false, this parameter will be null.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.BoxItem.Flex
member.summary: This configuation option is to be applied to child items of the container managed by this layout. Each child item with a flex property will be flexed horizontally according to each item's relative flex value compared to the sum of all items with a flex value specified. Any child items that have either a flex = 0 or flex = undefined will not be 'flexed' (the initial size will not be changed).
