member.name: T:Ext.Net.DDTarget
member.summary: A DragDrop implementation that does not move, but can be a drop target. You would get the same result by simply omitting implementation for the event callbacks, but this way we reduce the processing cost of the event listener and the callbacks.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DropTarget.Group
member.summary: A named drag drop group to which this object belongs. If a group is specified, then this object will only interact with other drag drop objects in the same group (defaults to undefined).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DropTarget.DropAllowed
member.summary: The CSS class returned to the drag source when drop is allowed (defaults to "x-dd-drop-ok").

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DropTarget.DropNotAllowed
member.summary: The CSS class returned to the drag source when drop is not allowed (defaults to "x-dd-drop-nodrop").

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DropTarget.OverClass
member.summary: The CSS class applied to the drop target element while the drag source is over it (defaults to "").

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DropTarget.ContainerScroll
member.summary: True to register this container with the Scrollmanager for auto scrolling during drag operations.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DropTarget.NotifyDrop
member.summary: The function a Ext.dd.DragSource calls once to notify this drop target that the dragged item has been dropped on it. This method has no default implementation and returns false, so you must provide an implementation that does something to process the drop event and returns true so that the drag source's repair action does not run. Parameters: source : The drag source that was dragged over this drop target e : The event data : An object containing arbitrary data supplied by the drag source

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DropTarget.NotifyEnter
member.summary: The function a Ext.dd.DragSource calls once to notify this drop target that the source is now over the target. This default implementation adds the CSS class specified by overClass (if any) to the drop element and returns the dropAllowed config value. This method should be overridden if drop validation is required. Parameters: source : The drag source that was dragged over this drop target e : The event data : An object containing arbitrary data supplied by the drag source

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DropTarget.NotifyOut
member.summary: The function a Ext.dd.DragSource calls once to notify this drop target that the source has been dragged out of the target without dropping. This default implementation simply removes the CSS class specified by overClass (if any) from the drop element. Parameters: source : The drag source that was dragged over this drop target e : The event data : An object containing arbitrary data supplied by the drag source

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DropTarget.NotifyOver
member.summary: The function a Ext.dd.DragSource calls continuously while it is being dragged over the target. This method will be called on every mouse movement while the drag source is over the drop target. This default implementation simply returns the dropAllowed config value. Parameters: source : The drag source that was dragged over this drop target e : The event data : An object containing arbitrary data supplied by the drag source

member.summary: True to prevent the default action.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.BaseListener.StopPropagation
member.summary: True to prevent event propagation.

member.summary: False to pass a browser event to the handler function instead of an Ext.EventObject.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.BaseListener.Delay
member.summary: The number of milliseconds to delay the invocation of the handler after the event fires.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.BaseListener.Single
member.summary: True to add a handler to handle just the next firing of the event, and then remove itself.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.BaseListener.Buffer
member.summary: Causes the handler to be scheduled to run in an Ext.util.DelayedTask delayed by the specified number of milliseconds. If the event fires again within that time, the original handler is not invoked, but the new handler is scheduled in its place.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ComponentListener.AutoPostBack

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ComponentListener.Fn
member.summary: The handler function the event invokes. This function is passed the following parameters: evt : EventObject The EventObject describing the event. t : Element The Element which was the target of the event. Note that this may be filtered by using the delegate option. o : Object The options object from the addListener call.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ComponentListener.Handler

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ComponentListener.IsAlmostDefault

member.name: P:Ext.Net.PanelDirectEvents.Activate
member.summary: Fires after the Panel has been visually activated. Note that Panels do not directly support being activated, but some Panel subclasses do (like Ext.Window). Panels which are child Components of a TabPanel fire the activate and deactivate events under the control of the TabPanel.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.PanelDirectEvents.BeforeClose

member.summary: Fires after the Panel has been collapsed.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.PanelDirectEvents.Deactivate

member.name: P:Ext.Net.TextFieldBase.Regex
member.summary: A JavaScript RegExp object to be tested against the field value during validation (defaults to null). If available, this regex will be evaluated only after the basic validators all return true, and will be passed the current field value. If the test fails, the field will be marked invalid using RegexText.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.TextFieldBase.RegexText
member.summary: The error text to display if regex is used and the test fails during validation (defaults to '').

member.name: P:Ext.Net.TextFieldBase.SelectOnFocus
member.summary: True to automatically select any existing field text when the field receives input focus (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.TextFieldBase.Truncate
member.summary: If MaxLength property has been set, more characters than the MaxLength can be entered if Truncate='false'. If 'false', then a validation error is rendered if more characters entered (or pasted) than the MaxLength property. Default value is 'true'.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.TextFieldBase.Validator
member.summary: A custom validation function to be called during field validation (defaults to null). If available, this function will be called only after the basic validators all return true, and will be passed the current field value and expected to return boolean true if the value is valid or a string error message if invalid.

member.summary: The paging status message to display (defaults to 'Displaying {0} - {1} of {2}'). Note that this string is formatted using the braced numbers 0-2 as tokens that are replaced by the values for start, end and total respectively. These tokens should be preserved when overriding this string if showing those values is desired.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ButtonBase.Config.AutoWidth
member.summary: By default, if a width is not specified the button will attempt to stretch horizontally to fit its content. If the button is being managed by a width sizing layout (hbox, fit, anchor), set this to false to prevent the button from doing this automatic sizing. Defaults to undefined.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ButtonBase.Config.StandOut
member.summary: True to enable stand out by default (defaults to false).

member.summary: The JavaScript to execute when the Button is clicked. Or, please use the <Listeners> for more flexibility.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ButtonBase.Config.AllowDepress
member.summary: False to not allow a pressed Button to be depressed (defaults to true). Only valid when enableToggle is true.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ButtonBase.Config.ArrowAlign
member.summary: The side of the Button box to render the arrow if the button has an associated menu. Defaults to 'Right'.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ButtonBase.Config.ClickEvent
member.summary: The type of event to map to the button's event handler (defaults to 'click').

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ButtonBase.Config.EnableToggle
member.summary: True to enable pressed/not pressed toggling (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ButtonBase.Config.Flat
member.summary: True to apply a flat style.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ButtonBase.Config.FormBind
member.summary: Buttons in the footer of a FormPanel may be configured with the option formBind: true. This causes the form's valid state monitor task to enable/disable those Buttons depending on the form's valid/invalid state.

member.name: T:Ext.Net.BorderLayoutRegion
member.summary: This is a region of a BorderLayout that acts as a subcontainer within the layout. Each region has its own layout that is independent of other regions and the containing BorderLayout, and can be any of the valid Ext layout types.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.BorderLayoutRegion.Items
member.summary: Region items

member.name: P:Ext.Net.BorderLayoutRegion.AnimFloat
member.summary: When a collapsed region's bar is clicked, the region's panel will be displayed as a floated panel that will close again once the user mouses out of that panel (or clicks out if AutoHide = false). Setting animFloat to false will prevent the open and close of these floated panels from being animated (defaults to true).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.BorderLayoutRegion.AutoHide
member.summary: When a collapsed region's bar is clicked, the region's panel will be displayed as a floated panel. If autoHide is true, the panel will automatically hide after the user mouses out of the panel. If autoHide is false, the panel will continue to display until the user clicks outside of the panel (defaults to true).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.BorderLayoutRegion.CMarginsSummary
member.summary: A string containing margins to apply to the region's collapsed element. Example '5 0 5 0' (addToStart, Right, Bottom, Left)

member.name: P:Ext.Net.BorderLayoutRegion.CMargins
member.summary: An object containing margins to apply to the region's collapsed element.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.BorderLayoutRegion.CollapseMode
member.summary: By default, collapsible regions are collapsed by clicking the expand/collapse tool button that renders into the region's title bar. Optionally, when collapseMode is set to 'mini' the region's split bar will also display a small collapse button in the center of the bar. In 'mini' mode the region will collapse to a thinner bar than in normal mode. By default collapseMode is undefined, and the only two supported values are undefined and 'mini'. Note that if a collapsible region does not have a title bar, then collapseMode must be set to 'mini' in order for the region to be collapsible by the user as the tool button will not be rendered.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.BorderLayoutRegion.Collapsible
member.summary: True to allow the user to collapse this region (defaults to false). If true, an expand/collapse tool button will automatically be rendered into the title bar of the region, otherwise the button will not be shown. Note that a title bar is required to display the toggle button -- if no region title is specified, the region will only be collapsible if CollapseMode is set to 'Mini'.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.BorderLayoutRegion.Floatable
member.summary: True to allow clicking a collapsed region's bar to display the region's panel floated above the layout, false to force the user to fully expand a collapsed region by clicking the expand button to see it again (defaults to true).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.BorderLayoutRegion.MarginsSummary
member.summary: An string containing margins to apply to the region. Example '5 0 5 0' (addToStart, Right, Bottom, Left)

member.name: P:Ext.Net.BorderLayoutRegion.Margins
member.summary: An object containing margins to apply to the region.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.BorderLayoutRegion.MinHeight
member.summary: The minimum allowable height in pixels for this region (defaults to 50)

member.name: P:Ext.Net.BorderLayoutRegion.MaxHeight
member.summary: The maximum allowable height in pixels for this region

member.name: P:Ext.Net.BorderLayoutRegion.MaxWidth
member.summary: The maximum allowable width in pixels for this region.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.BorderLayoutRegion.MinWidth
member.summary: The minimum allowable width in pixels for this region (defaults to 50)

member.name: P:Ext.Net.BorderLayoutRegion.UseSplitTips
member.summary: True to display a tooltip when the user hovers over a region's split bar (defaults to false). The tooltip text will be the value of either SplitTip or CollapsibleSplitTip as appropriate.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.BorderLayoutRegion.CollapsibleSplitTip
member.summary: The tooltip to display when the user hovers over a collapsible region's split bar. Only applies if UseSplitTips = true.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.BorderLayoutRegion.ExpandableSplitTip
member.summary: The tooltip to display when the user hovers over a collapsible region's split bar. Only applies if UseSplitTips = true.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.BorderLayoutRegion.Split
member.summary: True to display a SplitBar between this region and its neighbor, allowing the user to resize the regions dynamically (defaults to false). When split = true, it is common to specify a minSize and maxSize for the region.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.BorderLayoutRegion.SplitTip
member.summary: The tooltip to display when the user hovers over a non-collapsible region's split bar. Only applies if UseSplitTips = true.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.BorderLayoutRegion.Config.Items
member.summary: Region items

member.summary: The header text to display in the Grid view.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.TreeGridColumn.Template
member.summary: Specify a string to pass as the configuration string for Ext.XTemplate. By default an Ext.XTemplate will be implicitly created using the dataIndex.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.TreeGridColumn.XTemplate
member.summary: An XTemplate to use to process a Record's data to produce a column's rendered value.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.TreeGridColumn.Width
member.summary: Percentage of the container width this column should be allocated. Columns that have no width specified will be allocated with an equal percentage to fill 100% of the container width. To easily take advantage of the full container width, leave the width of at least one column undefined. Note that if you do not want to take up the full width of the container, the width of every column needs to be explicitly defined.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.CheckboxGroupBase.AllowBlank
member.summary: False to validate that at least one item in the group is checked (defaults to true). If no items are selected at validation time, BlankText will be used as the error text.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.CheckboxGroupBase.BlankText
member.summary: Error text to display if the AllowBlank validation fails (defaults to 'You must select at least one item in this group')

member.name: P:Ext.Net.CheckboxGroupBase.ColumnsNumber
member.summary: Specifies the number of columns to use when displaying grouped checkbox/radio controls using automatic layout.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.CheckboxGroupBase.ColumnsWidths
member.summary: You can also specify an array of column widths, mixing integer (fixed width) and float (percentage width) values as needed (e.g., [100, .25, .75]). Any integer values will be rendered first, then any float values will be calculated as a percentage of the remaining space. Float values do not have to add up to 1 (100%) although if you want the controls to take up the entire field container you should do so.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.CheckboxGroupBase.FireChangeOnLoad
member.summary: Fire change event after rendering

member.name: P:Ext.Net.CheckboxGroupBase.Vertical
member.summary: True to distribute contained controls across columns, completely filling each column top to bottom before starting on the next column. The number of controls in each column will be automatically calculated to keep columns as even as possible. The default value is false, so that controls will be added to columns one at a time, completely filling each row left to right before starting on the next row.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ListViewColumn.Align
member.summary: Set the CSS text-align property of the column. Defaults to 'left'.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ListViewColumn.Cls
member.summary: Optional. This option can be used to add a CSS class to the cell of each row for this column.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ListViewColumn.DataIndex
member.summary: (optional) The name of the field in the grid's Store's Record definition from which to draw the column's value. If not specified, the column's index is used as an index into the Record's data Array.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ListViewColumn.Header
member.summary: The header text to display in the Grid view.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ListViewColumn.Sortable
member.summary: Specify true to enable sorting on this column (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ListViewColumn.Template
member.summary: Specify a string to pass as the configuration string for Ext.XTemplate. By default an Ext.XTemplate will be implicitly created using the dataIndex.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ListViewColumn.XTemplate
member.summary: An XTemplate to use to process a Record's data to produce a column's rendered value.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ListViewColumn.Width
member.summary: Percentage of the container width this column should be allocated. Columns that have no width specified will be allocated with an equal percentage to fill 100% of the container width. To easily take advantage of the full container width, leave the width of at least one column undefined. Note that if you do not want to take up the full width of the container, the width of every column needs to be explicitly defined.

member.name: T:Ext.Net.ToolbarDroppable
member.summary: Plugin which allows items to be dropped onto a toolbar and be turned into new Toolbar items. To use the plugin, you just need to provide a createItem implementation that takes the drop data as an argument and returns an object that can be placed onto the toolbar.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ToolbarDroppable.CreateItem
member.summary: Creates the new toolbar item based on drop data. This method must be implemented by the plugin instance Parameters: data : Arbitrary data from the drop Return: An item that can be added to a toolbar

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ToolbarDroppable.CanDrop
member.summary: Returns true if the drop is allowed on the drop target. This function can be overridden and defaults to simply return true Parameters: data : Arbitrary data from the drop Return: True if the drop is allowed

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ToolbarDroppable.CalculateEntryIndex
member.summary: Calculates the location on the toolbar to create the new sorter button based on the XY of the drag event Parameters: e : The event object Return: The index at which to insert the new button

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ToolbarDroppable.Mode
member.summary: Set to 'remote' if need remote item creation.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ToolbarDroppable.BeforeRemoteCreate
member.summary: Calls before remote request Parameters: e : The event object - data, - options, - dragSource, - event Return: False to cancel request

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ToolbarDroppable.AfterRemoteCreate
member.summary: Calls before remote request Parameters: e : The event object - success - message - response - o

member.name: T:Ext.Net.EventEditForm
member.summary: A custom form used for detailed editing of events. This is pretty much a standard form that is simply pre-configured for the options needed by the calendar components. It is also configured to automatically bind records of type Ext.calendar.EventRecord to and from the form. This form also provides custom events specific to the calendar so that other calendar components can be easily notified when an event has been edited via this component.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.TreeSorter.SortType
member.summary: A custom "casting" function used to convert node values before sorting. The function will be called with a single parameter (the Ext.tree.TreeNode being evaluated) and is expected to return the node's sort value cast to the specific data type required for sorting. This could be used, for example, when a node's text (or other attribute) should be sorted as a date or numeric value. See the class description for example usage. Note that if a sortType is specified, any property config will be ignored. Parameters: e : the mousedown event

member.summary: A callback function which is called when the dialog is dismissed either by clicking on the configured buttons, or on the dialog close button, or by pressing the return button to enter input. Progress and wait dialogs will ignore this option since they do not respond to user actions and can only be closed programmatically, so any required function should be called by the same code after it closes the dialog. Parameters passed: buttonId : String The ID of the button pressed, one of: ok yes no cancel text : String Value of the input field if either prompt or multiline is true

See Component.CtCls also. Note: ExtraCls defaults to '' except for the following classes which assign a value by default: Absolute Layout : 'x-abs-layout-item' Box Layout : 'x-box-item' Column Layout : 'x-column' To configure the above Classes with an extra CSS class append to the default. For example, for ColumnLayout: extraCls: 'x-column custom-class'

member.name: T:Ext.Net.TriggerFieldBase
member.summary: Provides a convenient wrapper for TextFields that adds a clickable trigger button (looks like a combobox by default). The trigger has no default action, so you must assign a function to implement the trigger click handler by overriding onTriggerClick. You can create a TriggerField directly, as it renders exactly like a combobox for which you can provide a custom implementation.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ComboBoxBase`1.HiddenName
member.summary: If specified, a hidden form field with this name is dynamically generated to store the field's data value (defaults to the underlying DOM element's name). Required for the combo's value to automatically post during a form submission.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ComboBoxBase`1.ItemSelector
member.summary: This setting is required if a custom XTemplate has been specified in tpl which assigns a class other than 'x-combo-list-item' to dropdown list items. A simple CSS selector (e.g. div.some-class or span:first-child) that will be used to determine what nodes the DataView which handles the dropdown display will be working with.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ComboBoxBase`1.LazyInit
member.summary: True to not initialize the list for this combo until the field is focused. (defaults to true).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ComboBoxBase`1.LazyRender
member.summary: True to prevent the ComboBox from rendering until requested (should always be used when rendering into an Ext.Editor, defaults to false).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ComboBoxBase`1.FireSelectOnLoad
member.summary: True to fire select event after setValue on page load

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ComboBoxBase`1.ListAlign
member.summary: A valid anchor position value. See Ext.Element.alignTo for details on supported anchor positions (defaults to 'tl-bl').

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ComboBoxBase`1.ListClass
member.summary: CSS class to apply to the dropdown list element (defaults to '').

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ComboBoxBase`1.ListWidth
member.summary: The width in pixels of the dropdown list (defaults to the width of the ComboBox field).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ComboBoxBase`1.LoadingText
member.summary: The text to display in the dropdown list while data is loading. Only applies when mode = 'remote' (defaults to 'Loading...').

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ComboBoxBase`1.MaxHeight
member.summary: The maximum height in pixels of the dropdown list before scrollbars are shown (defaults to 300).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ComboBoxBase`1.MinHeight
member.summary: The minimum height in pixels of the dropdown list when the list is constrained by its distance to the viewport edges (defaults to 90).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ComboBoxBase`1.MinChars
member.summary: The minimum number of characters the user must type before autocomplete and typeahead activate (defaults to 4 if remote or 0 if local, does not apply if editable = false).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ComboBoxBase`1.MinListWidth
member.summary: The minimum width of the dropdown list in pixels (defaults to 70, will be ignored if listWidth has a higher value).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ComboBoxBase`1.Mode
member.summary: Set to 'local' if the ComboBox loads local data (defaults to 'remote' which loads from the server).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ComboBoxBase`1.PageSize
member.summary: If greater than 0, a paging toolbar is displayed in the footer of the dropdown list and the filter queries will execute with page addToStart and limit parameters. Only applies when mode = 'remote' (defaults to 0).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ComboBoxBase`1.QueryDelay
member.summary: The length of time in milliseconds to delay between the addToStart of typing and sending the query to filter the dropdown list (defaults to 500 if mode = 'remote' or 10 if mode = 'local').

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ComboBoxBase`1.QueryParam
member.summary: Name of the query as it will be passed on the querystring (defaults to 'query').

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ComboBoxBase`1.Resizable
member.summary: True to add a resize handle to the bottom of the dropdown list (defaults to false)

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ComboBoxBase`1.SelectedClass
member.summary: CSS class to apply to the selected items in the dropdown list (defaults to 'x-combo-selected').

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ComboBoxBase`1.Shadow
member.summary: 'Sides' for the default effect, 'Frame' for 4-way shadow, and 'Drop' for bottom-right.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ComboBoxBase`1.EnableShadow
member.summary: true for the default effect

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ComboBoxBase`1.SelectOnFocus
member.summary: True to automatically select any existing field text when the field receives input focus (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ComboBoxBase`1.Template
member.summary: The template string to use to display each item in the dropdown list.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ComboBoxBase`1.Transform
member.summary: The ID of an existing select to convert to a ComboBox.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ComboBoxBase`1.Title
member.summary: If supplied, a header element is created containing this text and added into the top of the dropdown list.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ComboBoxBase`1.TriggerAction
member.summary: The action to execute when the trigger field is activated. Use 'All' to run the query specified by the allQuery config option (defaults to 'Query').

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ComboBoxBase`1.TypeAhead
member.summary: True to populate and autoselect the remainder of the text being typed after a configurable delay (typeAheadDelay) if it matches a known value (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ComboBoxBase`1.TypeAheadDelay
member.summary: The length of time in milliseconds to wait until the typeahead text is displayed if TypeAhead = true (defaults to 250).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ComboBoxBase`1.ValueField
member.summary: The underlying data value name to bind to this ComboBox (defaults to undefined if mode = 'remote' or 'value' if transforming a select) Note: use of a valueField requires the user to make a selection in order for a value to be mapped.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ComboBoxBase`1.ValueNotFoundText

member.summary: Returns the element used to house this ComboBox's pop-up list. Defaults to the document body. member.name: T:Ext.Net.CardLayout
member.summary: This layout contains multiple panels, each fit to the content Container, where only a single panel can be visible at any given time. This layout style is most commonly used for wizards, tab implementations, etc. This class is intended to be extended or created via the layout:'card' Ext.Container.layout config, and should generally not need to be created directly via the new keyword.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.CardLayout.DeferredRender
member.summary: True to render each contained items at the time it becomes active, false to render all contained items as soon as the layout is rendered (defaults to false). If there is a significant amount of content or a lot of heavy controls being rendered into panels that are not displayed by default, setting this to true might improve performance.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.CardLayout.LayoutOnCardChange
member.summary: True to force a layout of the active item when the active card is changed. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.CardLayout.Config.DeferredRender
member.summary: True to render each contained items at the time it becomes active, false to render all contained items as soon as the layout is rendered (defaults to false). If there is a significant amount of content or a lot of heavy controls being rendered into panels that are not displayed by default, setting this to true might improve performance.

member.summary: Fits the window within its current container and automatically replaces the 'maximize' tool button with the 'restore' tool button.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.WindowBase.Minimize
member.summary: Placeholder method for minimizing the window. By default, this method simply fires the minimize event since the behavior of minimizing a window is application-specific. To implement custom minimize behavior, either the minimize event can be handled or this method can be overridden.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.WindowBase.Restore
member.summary: Restores a maximized window back to its original size and position prior to being maximized and also replaces the 'restore' tool button with the 'maximize' tool button.

member.summary: Makes this the active window by showing its shadow, or deactivates it by hiding its shadow. This method also fires the activate or deactivate event depending on which action occurred.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.WindowBase.AnimateTarget
member.summary: Id or element from which the window should animate while opening (defaults to null with no animation).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.WindowBase.Closable
member.summary: True to display the 'close' tool button and allow the user to close the window, false to hide the button and disallow closing the window (default to true).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.WindowBase.CloseAction
member.summary: The action to take when the close button is clicked. The default action is 'close' which will actually remove the window from the DOM and destroy it. The other valid option is 'hide' which will simply hide the window by setting visibility to hidden and applying negative offsets, keeping the window available to be redisplayed via the show method.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.WindowBase.Constrain
member.summary: True to constrain the window to the viewport, false to allow it to fall outside of the viewport (defaults to false). Optionally the header only can be constrained using ConstrainHeader.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.WindowBase.ConstrainHeader
member.summary: True to constrain the window header to the viewport, allowing the window body to fall outside of the viewport, false to allow the header to fall outside the viewport (defaults to false). Optionally the entire window can be constrained using constrain.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.WindowBase.DefaultButton
member.summary: The id of a button to focus when this window received the focus.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.WindowBase.DefaultRenderTo
member.summary: The default render to Element (Body or Form). Using when AutoRender="false"

member.name: P:Ext.Net.WindowBase.Draggable
member.summary: True to allow the window to be dragged by the header bar, false to disable dragging (defaults to true). Note that by default the window will be centered in the viewport, so if dragging is disabled the window may need to be positioned programmatically after render (e.g., myWindow.setPosition(100, 100);).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.WindowBase.ExpandOnShow
member.summary: True to always expand the window when it is displayed, false to keep it in its current state (which may be collapsed) when displayed (defaults to true).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.WindowBase.Maximizable
member.summary: True to display the 'maximize' tool button and allow the user to maximize the window, false to hide the button and disallow maximizing the window (defaults to false). Note that when a window is maximized, the tool button will automatically change to a 'restore' button with the appropriate behavior already built-in that will restore the window to its previous size.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.WindowBase.Maximized
member.summary: True to initially display the window in a maximized state. (Defaults to false).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.WindowBase.Height
member.summary: The height of this component in pixels (defaults to auto).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.WindowBase.MinHeight
member.summary: The minimum height in pixels allowed for this window (defaults to 100).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.WindowBase.Width
member.summary: The width of this component in pixels (defaults to auto).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.WindowBase.MinWidth
member.summary: The minimum width in pixels allowed for this window (defaults to 200). Only applies when resizable = true.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.WindowBase.Minimizable
member.summary: True to display the 'minimize' tool button and allow the user to minimize the window, false to hide the button and disallow minimizing the window (defaults to false). Note that this button provides no implementation -- the behavior of minimizing a window is implementation-specific, so the minimize event must be handled and a custom minimize behavior implemented for this option to be useful.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.WindowBase.Modal
member.summary: True to make the window modal and mask everything behind it when displayed, false to display it without restricting access to other UI elements (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.WindowBase.OnEsc
member.summary: Allows override of the built-in processing for the escape key. Default action is to close the Window (performing whatever action is specified in closeAction. To prevent the Window closing when the escape key is pressed, specify this as Ext.emptyFn (See Ext.emptyFn).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.WindowBase.Plain
member.summary: True to render the window body with a transparent background so that it will blend into the framing elements, false to add a lighter background color to visually highlight the body element and separate it more distinctly from the surrounding frame (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.WindowBase.Resizable
member.summary: True to allow user resizing at each edge and corner of the window, false to disable resizing (defaults to true).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.WindowBase.ResizeHandles
member.summary:
A valid Ext.Resizable handles config string (defaults to 'all'). Only applies when resizable = true.
Value Description ------ ------------------- 'n' north 's' south 'e' east 'w' west 'nw' northwest 'sw' southwest 'se' southeast 'ne' northeast 'all' all

member.name: M:Ext.Net.TreePanelBase.Bubble(System.String,Ext.Net.JFunction,System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Bubbles up the tree from this node, calling the specified function with each node. The scope (this) of function call will be the scope provided or the current node. The arguments to the function will be the args provided or the current node. If the function returns false at any point, the bubble is stopped.
member.param: The scope of the function (defaults to current node)
The args to call the function with (default to passing the current node)

member.name: M:Ext.Net.TreePanelBase.Bubble(System.String,Ext.Net.JFunction)
member.summary: Bubbles up the tree from this node, calling the specified function with each node. The scope (this) of function call will be the scope provided or the current node. member.name: M:Ext.Net.TreePanelBase.Cascade(System.String,Ext.Net.JFunction,System.String,System.String[])

The arguments to the function will be the args provided or the current node. If the function returns false at any point, the cascade is stopped on that branch.
member.param: The scope of the function (defaults to current node)
The args to call the function with (default to passing the current node)

member.summary: Scrolls to a particular tab if tab scrolling is enabled

member.summary: The ID of the container which has card layout. TabStrip will switch active item automatically beased on the current index.

member.summary: The container which has card layout. TabStrip will switch active item automatically beased on the current index.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.TabStrip.ActiveTabIndex
member.summary: The numeric index of the tab that should be initially activated on render.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.TabStrip.AnimScroll
member.summary: True to animate tab scrolling so that hidden tabs slide smoothly into view (defaults to true). Only applies when EnableTabScroll = true.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.TabStrip.EnableTabScroll
member.summary: True to enable scrolling to tabs that may be invisible due to overflowing the overall TabPanel width. Only available with tabs on addToStart. (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.TabStrip.MinTabWidth
member.summary: The minimum width in pixels for each tab when ResizeTabs = true (defaults to 30).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.TabStrip.Plain
member.summary: True to render the tab strip without a background content Container image (defaults to true).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.TabStrip.ResizeTabs
member.summary: True to automatically resize each tab so that the tabs will completely fill the tab strip (defaults to false). Setting this to true may cause specific widths that might be set per tab to be overridden in order to fit them all into view (although MinTabWidth will always be honored).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.TabStrip.SyncOnTabChange
member.summary: Sync size after active tab change. This property is ignored if AutoGrow=false

member.name: P:Ext.Net.TabStrip.AutoGrow
member.summary: True to auto grow width.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.TabStrip.ScrollDuration
member.summary: The number of milliseconds that each scroll animation should last (defaults to .35). Only applies when AnimScroll = true.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.TabStrip.ScrollIncrement
member.summary: The number of pixels to scroll each time a tab scroll button is pressed (defaults to 100, or if ResizeTabs = true, the calculated tab width). Only applies when EnableTabScroll = true.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.TabStrip.ScrollRepeatInterval
member.summary: Number of milliseconds between each scroll while a tab scroll button is continuously pressed (defaults to 400).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.TabStrip.TabMargin
member.summary: The number of pixels of space to calculate into the sizing and scrolling of tabs. If you change the margin in CSS, you will need to update this value so calculations are correct with either resizeTabs or scrolling tabs. (defaults to 2)

member.name: P:Ext.Net.TabStrip.TabCls
member.summary: This config option is used on child Components of ths TabPanel. A CSS class name applied to the tab strip item representing the child Component, allowing special styling to be applied.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.TabStrip.TabPosition
member.summary: The position where the tab strip should be rendered (defaults to 'addToStart'). The only other supported value is 'Bottom'. Note that tab scrolling is only supported for position 'addToStart'.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.TabStrip.TabWidth
member.summary: The initial width in pixels of each new tab (defaults to 120).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.TabStrip.WheelIncrement
member.summary: For scrolling tabs, the number of pixels to increment on mouse wheel scrolling (defaults to 20).

member.summary: Client-side JavaScript Event Handlers

member.summary: Server-side Ajax Event Handlers

member.name: M:Ext.Net.TabStrip.Builder.ActionContainerID(System.String)
member.summary: The ID of the container which has card layout. TabStrip will switch active item automatically beased on the current index.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.TabStrip.Builder.ActionContainer(Ext.Net.Container)
member.summary: The container which has card layout. TabStrip will switch active item automatically beased on the current index.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.TabStrip.Builder.ActiveTabIndex(System.Int32)
member.summary: The numeric index of the tab that should be initially activated on render.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.TabStrip.Builder.AnimScroll(System.Boolean)
member.summary: True to animate tab scrolling so that hidden tabs slide smoothly into view (defaults to true). Only applies when EnableTabScroll = true.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.TabStrip.Builder.EnableTabScroll(System.Boolean)
member.summary: True to enable scrolling to tabs that may be invisible due to overflowing the overall TabPanel width. Only available with tabs on addToStart. (defaults to false).

member.name: M:Ext.Net.TabStrip.Builder.MinTabWidth(System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit)
member.summary: The minimum width in pixels for each tab when ResizeTabs = true (defaults to 30).

member.name: M:Ext.Net.TabStrip.Builder.Plain(System.Boolean)
member.summary: True to render the tab strip without a background content Container image (defaults to true).

member.name: M:Ext.Net.TabStrip.Builder.ResizeTabs(System.Boolean)
member.summary: True to automatically resize each tab so that the tabs will completely fill the tab strip (defaults to false). Setting this to true may cause specific widths that might be set per tab to be overridden in order to fit them all into view (although MinTabWidth will always be honored).

member.name: M:Ext.Net.TabStrip.Builder.SyncOnTabChange(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sync size after active tab change. This property is ignored if AutoGrow=false

member.name: M:Ext.Net.TabStrip.Builder.AutoGrow(System.Boolean)
member.summary: True to auto grow width

member.name: M:Ext.Net.TabStrip.Builder.ScrollDuration(System.Single)
member.summary: The number of milliseconds that each scroll animation should last (defaults to .35). Only applies when AnimScroll = true.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.TabStrip.Builder.ScrollIncrement(System.Int32)
member.summary: The number of pixels to scroll each time a tab scroll button is pressed (defaults to 100, or if ResizeTabs = true, the calculated tab width). Only applies when EnableTabScroll = true.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.TabStrip.Builder.ScrollRepeatInterval(System.Int32)
member.summary: Number of milliseconds between each scroll while a tab scroll button is continuously pressed (defaults to 400).

member.name: M:Ext.Net.TabStrip.Builder.TabMargin(System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit)
member.summary: The number of pixels of space to calculate into the sizing and scrolling of tabs. If you change the margin in CSS, you will need to update this value so calculations are correct with either resizeTabs or scrolling tabs. (defaults to 2)

member.name: M:Ext.Net.TabStrip.Builder.TabCls(System.String)
member.summary: This config option is used on child Components of ths TabPanel. A CSS class name applied to the tab strip item representing the child Component, allowing special styling to be applied.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.TabStrip.Builder.TabPosition(Ext.Net.TabPosition)
member.summary: The position where the tab strip should be rendered (defaults to 'addToStart'). The only other supported value is 'Bottom'. Note that tab scrolling is only supported for position 'addToStart'.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.TabStrip.Builder.TabWidth(System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit)
member.summary: The initial width in pixels of each new tab (defaults to 120).

member.name: M:Ext.Net.TabStrip.Builder.WheelIncrement(System.Int32)
member.summary: For scrolling tabs, the number of pixels to increment on mouse wheel scrolling (defaults to 20).

member.name: T:Ext.Net.XmlReader
member.summary:
Data reader class to create an Array of Ext.data.Record objects from an XML document based on mappings in a provided Ext.data.Record constructor.
Note that in order for the browser to parse a returned XML document, the Content-Type header in the HTTP response must be set to "text/xml".

member.name: T:Ext.Net.DataReader
member.summary: Abstract base class for reading structured data from a data source and converting it into an object containing RecordField objects and metadata for use by an Store. This class is intended to be extended and should not be created directly. For existing implementations, see ArrayReader, JsonReader and XmlReader.

member.name: T:Ext.Net.ProgressBar
member.summary: An updateable progress bar component. The progress bar supports two different modes: manual and automatic.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.ProgressBar.Reset
member.summary: Resets the progress bar value to 0 and text to empty string. If hide = true, the progress bar will also be hidden (using the hideMode property internally).

member.name: M:Ext.Net.ProgressBar.Reset(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Resets the progress bar value to 0 and text to empty string. If hide = true, the progress bar will also be hidden (using the hideMode property internally).
member.param: True to hide the progress bar

member.name: M:Ext.Net.ProgressBar.SyncProgressBar
member.summary: Synchronizes the inner bar width to the proper proportion of the total componet width based on the current progress value. This will be called automatically when the ProgressBar is resized by a layout, but if it is rendered auto width, this method can be called from another resize handler to sync the ProgressBar if necessary.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.ProgressBar.UpdateProgress(System.Single)
member.summary: Updates the progress bar value, and optionally its text. If the text argument is not specified, any existing text value will be unchanged. To blank out existing text, pass ''. Note that even if the progress bar value exceeds 1, it will never automatically reset -- you are responsible for determining when the progress is complete and calling reset to clear and/or hide the control.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.ProgressBar.UpdateProgress(System.Single,System.String)
member.summary: Updates the progress bar value, and optionally its text. If the text argument is not specified, any existing text value will be unchanged. To blank out existing text, pass ''. Note that even if the progress bar value exceeds 1, it will never automatically reset -- you are responsible for determining when the progress is complete and calling reset to clear and/or hide the control.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.ProgressBar.UpdateText
member.summary: Updates the progress bar text. If specified, textEl will be updated, otherwise the progress bar itself will display the updated text.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.ProgressBar.UpdateText(System.String)
member.summary: Updates the progress bar text. If specified, textEl will be updated, otherwise the progress bar itself will display the updated text.
member.param: The string to display in the progress text element

member.name: M:Ext.Net.ProgressBar.Wait
member.summary: Initiates an auto-updating progress bar. A duration can be specified, in which case the progress bar will automatically reset after a fixed amount of time and optionally call a callback function if specified. If no duration is passed in, then the progress bar will run indefinitely and must be manually cleared by calling reset.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.ProgressBar.Wait(Ext.Net.WaitConfig)
member.summary: Initiates an auto-updating progress bar. A duration can be specified, in which case the progress bar will automatically reset after a fixed amount of time and optionally call a callback function if specified. If no duration is passed in, then the progress bar will run indefinitely and must be manually cleared by calling reset.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ProgressBar.BaseCls
member.summary: The base CSS class to apply to the progress bar's wrapper element (defaults to 'x-progress')

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ProgressBar.Text
member.summary: The progress bar text (defaults to '')

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ProgressBar.TextEl
member.summary: The element to render the progress text to (defaults to the progress bar's internal text element)

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ProgressBar.Value
member.summary: A floating point value between 0 and 1 (e.g., .5, defaults to 0)

member.name: P:Ext.Net.NumberColumn.Format
member.summary: A formatting string as used by Ext.util.Format.number to format a numeric value for this Column (defaults to '0,000.00'). Formats the number according to the format string. examples (123456.789): 0 - (123456) show only digits, no precision 0.00 - (123456.78) show only digits, 2 precision 0.0000 - (123456.7890) show only digits, 4 precision 0,000 - (123,456) show comma and digits, no precision 0,000.00 - (123,456.78) show comma and digits, 2 precision 0,0.00 - (123,456.78) shortcut method, show comma and digits, 2 precision To reverse the grouping (,) and decimal (.) for international numbers, add /i to the end. For example: 0.000,00/i

member.name: M:Ext.Net.NumberColumn.Builder.Format(System.String)
member.summary: A formatting string as used by Ext.util.Format.number to format a numeric value for this Column (defaults to '0,000.00').

member.name: T:Ext.Net.LoadMask
member.summary: A simple utility class for generically masking elements while loading data. If the element being masked has an underlying Ext.data.Store, the masking will be automatically synchronized with the store's loading process and the mask element will be cached for reuse. For all other elements, this mask will replace the element's UpdateOptions load indicator and will be destroyed after the initial load.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.LoadMask.ShowMask
member.summary: True to create a single-use mask that is automatically destroyed after loading (useful for page loads), False to persist the mask element reference for multiple uses (e.g., for paged data widgets). Defaults to false.

member.summary: The text to display in a centered loading message box (defaults to 'Loading...').

member.name: T:Ext.Net.Event
member.summary: This is the specification for calendar event data used by the CalendarPanel's underlying store. It can be overridden as necessary to customize the fields supported by events, although the existing column names should not be altered. If your model fields are named differently you should update the mapping configs accordingly. The only required fields when creating a new event record instance are StartDate and EndDate. All other fields are either optional are will be defaulted if blank.

member.name: T:Ext.Net.Window
member.summary: A specialized panel intended for use as an application window. Windows are floated and draggable by default, and also provide specific behavior like the ability to maximize and restore (with an event for minimizing, since the minimize behavior is application-specific). Windows can also be linked to a Ext.WindowGroup or managed by the Ext.WindowManager to provide grouping, activation, to front/back and other application-specific behavior.

member.summary: Synchronizes the thumb position to the proper proportion of the total component width based on the current slider value. member.name: P:Ext.Net.ElementFxConfig.Callback
member.summary: A function called when the effect is finished. Note that effects are queued internally by the Fx class, so do not need to use the callback parameter to specify another effect -- effects can simply be chained together and called in sequence (e.g., el.slideIn().highlight();). The callback is intended for any additional code that should run once a particular effect has completed. The Element being operated upon is passed as the first parameter.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ElementFxConfig.Duration
member.summary: The length of time (in seconds) that the effect should last

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ElementFxConfig.Easing
member.summary: A valid Easing value for the effect

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ElementFxConfig.Scope
member.summary: The scope of the effect function

member.name: P:Ext.Net.FxConfig.AfterCls
member.summary: A css class to apply after the effect

member.name: P:Ext.Net.FxConfig.AfterStyle
member.summary: A style specification string, e.g. "width:100px", that will be applied to the Element after the effect finishes

member.name: P:Ext.Net.FxConfig.Block
member.summary: Whether the effect should block other effects from queueing while it runs

member.name: P:Ext.Net.FxConfig.Concurrent
member.summary: Whether to allow subsequently-queued effects to run at the same time as the current effect, or to ensure that they run in sequence

member.name: P:Ext.Net.FxConfig.Remove
member.summary: Whether the Element should be removed from the DOM and destroyed after the effect finishes

member.name: P:Ext.Net.FxConfig.StopFx
member.summary: Whether subsequent effects should be stopped and removed after the current effect finishes

member.name: P:Ext.Net.FxConfig.UseDisplay
member.summary: Whether to use the display CSS property instead of visibility when hiding Elements (only applies to effects that end with the element being visually hidden, ignored otherwise)

member.summary: Can be any valid CSS property (attribute) that supports a color value

member.name: T:Ext.Net.AccordionLayout
member.summary: This is a base class for layouts that contain a single items that automatically expands to fill the layout's content Container. This class is intended to be extended or created via the layout:'fit' Ext.Container.layout config, and should generally not need to be created directly via the new keyword. FitLayout does not have any direct config options (other than inherited ones). To fit a panel to a content Container using FitLayout, simply set layout:'fit' on the content Container and add a single panel to it. If the content Container has multiple panels, only the first one will be displayed.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.AccordionLayout.ActiveOnTop
member.summary: True to swap the position of each panel as it is expanded so that it becomes the first items in the content Container, false to keep the panels in the rendered order. This is NOT compatible with 'animate:true' (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.AccordionLayout.OriginalHeader
member.summary: If true then original header UI is used.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.AccordionLayout.Animate
member.summary: True to slide the contained panels open and closed during expand/collapse using animation, false to open and close directly with no animation (defaults to false). Note: to defer to the specific config setting of each contained panel for this property, set this to undefined at the layout level.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.AccordionLayout.AutoWidth
member.summary: True to set each contained items's width to 'auto', false to use the items's current width (defaults to true).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.AccordionLayout.CollapseFirst
member.summary: True to make sure the collapse/expand toggle button always renders first (to the left of) any other tools in the contained panels' title bars, false to render it last (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.AccordionLayout.Fill
member.summary: True to adjust the active items's height to fill the available space in the content Container, false to use the items's current height, or auto height if not explicitly set (defaults to true).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.AccordionLayout.HideCollapseTool
member.summary: True to hide the contained panels' collapse/expand toggle buttons, false to display them (defaults to false). When set to true, titleCollapse should be true also.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.AccordionLayout.Sequence
member.summary: Experimental. If animate is set to true, this will result in each animation running in sequence.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.AccordionLayout.TitleCollapse
member.summary: True to allow expand/collapse of each contained panel by clicking anywhere on the title bar, false to allow expand/collapse only when the toggle tool button is clicked (defaults to true). When set to false, hideCollapseTool should be false also.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.AccordionLayout.Config.ActiveOnTop
member.summary: True to swap the position of each panel as it is expanded so that it becomes the first items in the content Container, false to keep the panels in the rendered order. This is NOT compatible with 'animate:true' (defaults to false).

member.name: M:Ext.Net.MessageBox.Alert(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Displays a standard read-only message box with an OK button (comparable to the basic JavaScript alert prompt). If a callback function is passed it will be called after the user clicks the button, and the id of the button that was clicked will be passed as the only parameter to the callback (could also be the top-right close button).

member.name: M:Ext.Net.MessageBox.Alert(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Displays a standard read-only message box with an OK button (comparable to the basic JavaScript alert prompt). If a callback function is passed it will be called after the user clicks the button, and the id of the button that was clicked will be passed as the only parameter to the callback (could also be the top-right close button).

member.name: M:Ext.Net.MessageBox.Alert(System.String,System.String,Ext.Net.JFunction)
member.summary: Displays a standard read-only message box with an OK button (comparable to the basic JavaScript alert prompt). If a callback function is passed it will be called after the user clicks the button, and the id of the button that was clicked will be passed as the only parameter to the callback (could also be the top-right close button).

member.name: M:Ext.Net.MessageBox.UpdateProgress(System.Single,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Updates a progress-style message box's text and progress bar. Only relevant on message boxes initiated via Ext.MessageBox.progress or Ext.MessageBox.wait, or by calling Ext.MessageBox.show with progress: true.
member.param: Any number between 0 and 1 (e.g., .5, defaults to 0)
The progress text to display inside the progress bar (defaults to '')
The message box's body text is replaced with the specified string (defaults to undefined so that any existing body text will not get overwritten by default unless a new value is passed in)

member.name: M:Ext.Net.MessageBox.Prompt(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Displays a message box with OK and Cancel buttons prompting the user to enter some text (comparable to JavaScript's prompt). The prompt can be a single-line or multi-line textbox. If a callback function is passed it will be called after the user clicks either button, and the id of the button that was clicked (could also be the top-right close button) and the text that was entered will be passed as the two parameters to the callback.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DataProxyListeners.BeforeLoad
member.summary: Fires before a request to retrieve a data object.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DataProxyListeners.BeforeWrite
member.summary: Fires before a request is generated for one of the actions Ext.data.Api.actions.create|update|destroy In addition to being fired through the DataProxy instance that raised the event, this event is also fired through the Ext.data.DataProxy class to allow for centralized processing of beforewrite events from all DataProxies by attaching a listener to the Ext.data.DataProxy class itself.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DataProxyListeners.Exception
member.summary: Fires if an exception occurs in the Proxy during a remote request. This event is relayed through a corresponding Ext.data.Store.exception, so any Store instance may observe this event. In addition to being fired through the DataProxy instance that raised the event, this event is also fired through the Ext.data.DataProxy class to allow for centralized processing of exception events from all DataProxies by attaching a listener to the Ext.data.DataProxy class itself.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DataProxyListeners.Load
member.summary: Fires before the load method's callback is called.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DataProxyListeners.Write
member.summary: Fires before the request-callback is called In addition to being fired through the DataProxy instance that raised the event, this event is also fired through the Ext.data.DataProxy class to allow for centralized processing of write events from all DataProxies by attaching a listener to the Ext.data.DataProxy class itself.

member.name: T:Ext.Net.FitLayout
member.summary: This is a base class for layouts that contain a single items that automatically expands to fill the layout's content Container. This class is intended to be extended or created via the layout:'fit' Ext.Container.layout config, and should generally not need to be created directly via the new keyword. FitLayout does not have any direct config options (other than inherited ones). To fit a panel to a content Container using FitLayout, simply set layout:'fit' on the content Container and add a single panel to it. If the content Container has multiple panels, only the first one will be displayed.

member.name: T:Ext.Net.CalendarPanel
member.summary: This is the default container for Ext calendar views. It supports day, week and month views as well as a built-in event edit form. The only requirement for displaying a calendar is passing in a valid calendarStore config containing records of type EventRecord. In order to make the calendar interactive (enable editing, drag/drop, etc.) you can handle any of the various events fired by the underlying views and exposed through the CalendarPanel.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.CalendarPanelBase.HideEditForm
member.summary: Hides the built-in event edit form and returns to the previous calendar view. If the edit form is not currently visible this method has no effect.

member.summary: Sets the start date for the currently-active calendar view.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.CalendarPanelBase.ShowEditForm(System.Object)
member.summary: Shows the built-in event edit form for the passed in event record. This method automatically hides the calendar views and navigation toolbar. To return to the calendar, call hideEditForm.
member.param: The event record id to edit

member.name: M:Ext.Net.CalendarPanelBase.ShowEditForm(System.Int32)
member.summary: Shows the built-in event edit form for the passed in event record. This method automatically hides the calendar views and navigation toolbar. To return to the calendar, call hideEditForm.
member.param: The event record index to edit

member.name: P:Ext.Net.AccordionLayoutConfig.ActiveOnTop
member.summary: True to swap the position of each panel as it is expanded so that it becomes the first item in the container, false to keep the panels in the rendered order. This is NOT compatible with Animate="true" (defaults to false).

member.summary: If true then original header UI is used.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.AccordionLayoutConfig.Animate
member.summary: True to slide the contained panels open and closed during expand/collapse using animation, false to open and close directly with no animation (defaults to false). Note: to defer to the specific config setting of each contained panel for this property, set this to undefined at the layout level.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.AccordionLayoutConfig.AutoWidth
member.summary: True to set each contained item's width to 'auto', false to use the item's current width (defaults to true). Note that some components, in particular the grid, will not function properly within layouts if they have auto width, so in such cases this config should be set to false.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.AccordionLayoutConfig.CollapseFirst
member.summary: True to make sure the collapse/expand toggle button always renders first (to the left of) any other tools in the contained panels' title bars, false to render it last (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.AccordionLayoutConfig.Fill
member.summary: True to adjust the active item's height to fill the available space in the container, false to use the item's current height, or auto height if not explicitly set (defaults to true).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.AccordionLayoutConfig.HideCollapseTool
member.summary: True to hide the contained panels' collapse/expand toggle buttons, false to display them (defaults to false). When set to true, titleCollapse should be true also.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.AccordionLayoutConfig.Sequence
member.summary: Experimental. If animate is set to true, this will result in each animation running in sequence.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.AccordionLayoutConfig.TitleCollapse
member.summary: True to allow expand/collapse of each contained panel by clicking anywhere on the title bar, false to allow expand/collapse only when the toggle tool button is clicked (defaults to true). When set to false, hideCollapseTool should be false also.

member.name: T:Ext.Net.HttpProxy
member.summary:
An implementation of DataProxy that reads a data object from a object configured to reference a certain URL.
Note that this class cannot be used to retrieve data from a domain other than the domain from which the running page was served.
For cross-domain access to remote data, use a ScriptTagProxy.
Be aware that to enable the browser to parse an XML document, the server must set the Content-Type header in the HTTP response to "text/xml".

member.name: T:Ext.Net.MonthView
member.summary: Displays a calendar view by month. This class does not usually need ot be used directly as you can use a CalendarPanel to manage multiple calendar views at once including the month view.

member.name: T:Ext.Net.CalendarView
member.summary: This is an abstract class that serves as the base for other calendar views. This class is not intended to be directly instantiated. When extending this class to create a custom calendar view, you must provide an implementation for the renderItems method, as there is no default implementation for rendering events The rendering logic is totally dependent on how the UI structures its data, which is determined by the underlying UI template (this base class does not have a template).

member.summary: Visually highlights an event using Ext.Fx.highlight config options. If highlightEventActions is false this method will have no effect.
member.param: (optional) The highlight color. Should be a 6 char hex color without the leading # (defaults to yellow: 'ffff9c')
(optional) Object literal with any of the Ext.Fx config options. See Ext.Fx.highlight for usage examples.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.CalendarView.DDMoveEventText
member.summary: The text to display inside the drag proxy while dragging an event to reposition it (defaults to 'Move event to {0}' where {0} is the updated event start date/time supplied by the view)

member.name: P:Ext.Net.CalendarView.DDResizeEventText
member.summary: The string displayed to the user in the drag proxy while dragging the resize handle of an event (defaults to 'Update event to {0}' where {0} is the updated event start-end range supplied by the view). Note that this text is only used in views that allow resizing of events.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.CalendarView.EnableAddFx
member.summary: True to enable a visual effect on adding a new event (the default), false to disable it. Note that if enableFx is false it will override this value. The specific effect that runs is defined in the doAddFx method.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.CalendarView.EnableDD
member.summary: True to enable drag and drop in the calendar view (the default), false to disable it

member.name: P:Ext.Net.CalendarView.EnableFx
member.summary: Determines whether or not visual effects for CRUD actions are enabled (defaults to true). If this is false it will override any values for enableAddFx, enableUpdateFx or enableRemoveFx and all animations will be disabled.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.CalendarView.EnableRemoveFx
member.summary: True to enable a visual effect on removing an event (the default), false to disable it. Note that if enableFx is false it will override this value. The specific effect that runs is defined in the doRemoveFx method.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.CalendarView.EnableUpdateFx
member.summary: True to enable a visual effect on updating an event, false to disable it (the default). Note that if enableFx is false it will override this value. The specific effect that runs is defined in the doUpdateFx method.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.CalendarView.MonitorResize
member.summary: True to monitor the browser's resize event (the default), false to ignore it. If the calendar view is rendered into a fixed-size container this can be set to false. However, if the view can change dimensions (e.g., it's in fit layout in a viewport or some other resizable container) it is very important that this config is true so that any resize event propagates properly to all subcomponents and layouts get recalculated properly.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.CalendarView.SpansHavePriority
member.summary: Allows switching between two different modes of rendering events that span multiple days. When true, span events are always sorted first, possibly at the expense of start dates being out of order (e.g., a span event that starts at 11am one day and spans into the next day would display before a non-spanning event that starts at 10am, even though they would not be in date order). This can lead to more compact layouts when there are many overlapping events. If false (the default), events will always sort by start date first which can result in a less compact, but chronologically consistent layout.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.CalendarView.TrackMouseOver
member.summary: Whether or not the view tracks and responds to the browser mouseover event on contained elements (defaults to true). If you don't need mouseover event highlighting you can disable this.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.CalendarView.GetEventBodyMarkup
member.summary: Returns a string of HTML template markup to be used as the body portion of the event template created by getEventTemplate. This provdes the flexibility to customize what's in the body without having to override the entire XTemplate. This string can include any valid Ext.Template code, and any data tokens accessible to the containing event template can be referenced in this string.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.CalendarView.GetEventTemplate
member.summary: Returns the XTemplate that is bound to the calendar's event store (it expects records of type Ext.calendar.EventRecord) to populate the calendar views with events. Internally this method by default generates different markup for browsers that support CSS border radius and those that don't. This method can be overridden as needed to customize the markup generated. Note that this method calls getEventBodyMarkup to retrieve the body markup for events separately from the surrounding container markup. This provdes the flexibility to customize what's in the body without having to override the entire XTemplate. If you do override this method, you should make sure that your overridden version also does the same.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.MonthViewBase.ShowHeader
member.summary: True to display a header beneath the navigation bar containing the week names above each week's column, false not to show it and instead display the week names in the first row of days in the calendar (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.MonthViewBase.ShowTime
member.summary: True to display the current time in today's box in the calendar, false to not display it (defautls to true)

member.name: P:Ext.Net.MonthViewBase.ShowTodayText
member.summary: True to display the todayText string in today's box in the calendar, false to not display it (defautls to true)

member.summary: True to display an extra column before the first day in the calendar that links to the view for each individual week, false to not show it (defaults to false). If true, the week links can also contain the week number depending on the value of showWeekNumbers.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.MonthViewBase.ShowWeekNumbers
member.summary: True to show the week number for each week in the calendar in the week link column, false to show nothing (defaults to false). Note that if showWeekLinks is false this config will have no affect even if true.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.MonthViewBase.WeekLinkOverClass

member.name: T:Ext.Net.DesktopWindow
member.summary: A specialized panel intended for use as an application window. Windows are floated and draggable by default, and also provide specific behavior like the ability to maximize and restore (with an event for minimizing, since the minimize behavior is application-specific). Windows can also be linked to a Ext.WindowGroup or managed by the Ext.WindowManager to provide grouping, activation, to front/back and other application-specific behavior.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DesktopWindow.Maximizable
member.summary: True to display the 'maximize' tool button and allow the user to maximize the window, false to hide the button and disallow maximizing the window (defaults to false). Note that when a window is maximized, the tool button will automatically change to a 'restore' button with the appropriate behavior already built-in that will restore the window to its previous size.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DesktopWindow.LazyRender
member.summary: True to force rendering otherwise rendering will be performed before the first showing.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DesktopWindow.ShowInTaskbar
member.summary: False to skip task button showing

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DesktopWindow.Minimizable
member.summary: True to display the 'minimize' tool button and allow the user to minimize the window, false to hide the button and disallow minimizing the window (defaults to false). Note that this button provides no implementation -- the behavior of minimizing a window is implementation-specific, so the minimize event must be handled and a custom minimize behavior implemented for this option to be useful.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DesktopWindow.Config.Maximizable
member.summary: True to display the 'maximize' tool button and allow the user to maximize the window, false to hide the button and disallow maximizing the window (defaults to false). Note that when a window is maximized, the tool button will automatically change to a 'restore' button with the appropriate behavior already built-in that will restore the window to its previous size.

member.summary: True to force rendering otherwise rendering will be performed before the first showing.

member.name: T:Ext.Net.ClickRepeater
member.summary: A wrapper class which can be applied to any element. Fires a "click" event while the mouse is pressed. The interval between firings may be specified in the config but defaults to 20 milliseconds. Optionally, a CSS class may be applied to the element during the time it is pressed.

member.summary: Enables the repeater and allows events to fire.

member.summary: True if autorepeating should start slowly and accelerate. Interval and Delay are ignored.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ClickRepeater.Delay
member.summary: The initial delay before the repeating event begins firing. Similar to an autorepeat key delay.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ClickRepeater.Target
member.summary: The element to act as a button.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.Extensions.ToElement(System.Web.UI.Control)
member.new: Added new .ToElement() Extension Method to Control which enables the easy explicit conversion of Control objects into Ext.Net.Element objects. Once converted into an Element, effect can be run against the Element, including .Show(), .Hide() and many other Animations. Method chaining default is "true".

member.name: M:Ext.Net.Extensions.ToElement(System.Web.UI.Control,System.Boolean)
member.new: Added extra chaining parameter to .ToElement() Extension Method. Default is "true".

member.name: P:Ext.Net.BoxLayoutConfig.DefaultMargins
member.summary: If the individual contained items do not have a margins property specified, the default margins from this property will be applied to each item. The order of the sides associated with each value matches the way CSS processes margin values: If there is only one value, it applies to all sides. If there are two values, the top and bottom borders are set to the first value and the right and left are set to the second. If there are three values, the top is set to the first value, the left and right are set to the second, and the bottom is set to the third. If there are four values, they apply to the top, right, bottom, and left, respectively.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.BoxLayoutConfig.Padding
member.summary: Defaults to '0'. Sets the padding to be applied to all child items managed by this container's layout.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.BoxLayoutConfig.Pack
member.summary: Controls how the child items of the container are packed together.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.BoxLayoutConfig.ScrollOffset
member.summary: The amount of space to reserve for the scrollbar

member.name: P:Ext.Net.CardLayoutConfig.DeferredRender
member.summary: True to render each contained item at the time it becomes active, false to render all contained items as soon as the layout is rendered (defaults to false). If there is a significant amount of content or a lot of heavy controls being rendered into panels that are not displayed by default, setting this to true might improve performance.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.CardLayoutConfig.LayoutOnCardChange
member.summary: True to force a layout of the active item when the active card is changed. Defaults to false.

member.name: T:Ext.Net.WeekView
member.summary: Displays a calendar view by week. This class does not usually need ot be used directly as you can use a CalendarPanel to manage multiple calendar views at once including the week view.

member.name: T:Ext.Net.DayView
member.summary: Unlike other calendar views, is not actually a subclass of CalendarView. Instead it is a Container subclass that internally creates and manages the layouts of a DayHeaderView and a DayBodyView. As such DayView accepts any config values that are valid for DayHeaderView and DayBodyView and passes those through to the contained views. It also supports the interface required of any calendar view and in turn calls methods on the contained views as necessary.

member.name: T:Ext.Net.Store
member.summary:
The Store class encapsulates a client side cache of Record objects which provide input data for Components such as the GridPanel, the ComboBox, or the DataView
A Store object uses its configured implementation of DataProxy to access a data object unless you call loadData directly and pass in your data.
A Store object has no knowledge of the format of the data returned by the Proxy.
A Store object uses its configured implementation of DataReader to create Record instances from the data object. These Records are cached and made available through accessor functions.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.StoreBase.LoadData(System.Object)
member.summary: Loads data from a passed data block. A Reader which understands the format of the data must have been configured in the constructor.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.StoreBase.LoadData(System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Loads data from a passed data block. A Reader which understands the format of the data must have been configured in the constructor.

member.summary: Inserts Record into the Store at the given index and fires the add event.

member.summary: (Local sort only) Inserts the passed Record into the Store at the index where it should go based on the current sort information.

member.summary: (Local sort only) Inserts the passed Record into the Store at the index where it should go based on the current sort information.
