member.param: Either a string that the field should begin with, or a RegExp (should be raw token) to test against the field.
True to match any part not just the beginning

member.name: M:Ext.Net.StoreBase.FilterBy(Ext.Net.JFunction)
member.summary: Filter by a function. The specified function will be called for each Record in this Store. If the function returns true the Record is included, otherwise it is filtered out.
member.param: The function to be called. It will be passed the following parameters: record - The record to test for filtering. Access field values using Ext.data.Record.get. id - The ID of the Record passed.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.StoreBase.FilterBy(Ext.Net.JFunction,System.String)
member.summary: Filter by a function. The specified function will be called for each Record in this Store. If the function returns true the Record is included, otherwise it is filtered out.
member.param: The function to be called. It will be passed the following parameters: record - The record to test for filtering. Access field values using Ext.data.Record.get. id - The ID of the Record passed.
The scope of the function (defaults to this)

member.name: P:Ext.Net.StoreBase.RemoteSort
member.summary: True if sorting is to be handled by requesting the Proxy to provide a refreshed version of the data object in sorted order, as opposed to sorting the Record cache in place (defaults to false). If remote sorting is specified, then clicking on a column header causes the current page to be requested from the server with the addition of the following two parameters: sort: String - The name (as specified in the Record's Field definition) of the field to sort on. dir : String - The direction of the sort, 'ASC' or 'DESC' (case-sensitive).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.StoreBase.RemotePaging
member.summary: True to perform remote paging

member.name: M:Ext.Net.StoreBase.Builder`2.AutoLoad(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If passed, this store's load method is automatically called after creation with the autoLoad object.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.StoreBase.Builder`2.Restful(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Defaults to false. Set to true to have the Store and the set Proxy operate in a RESTful manner.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.StoreBase.Builder`2.SaveAllFields(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Save ALL fields of a modified record -- not just those that changed.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.StoreBase.Builder`2.AutoSave(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Defaults to true causing the store to automatically save records to the server when a record is modified (ie: becomes 'dirty'). Specify false to manually call save to send all modifiedRecords to the server.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.StoreBase.Builder`2.AutoDecode(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If true then submitted data will be decoded

member.name: M:Ext.Net.StoreBase.Builder`2.PruneModifiedRecords(System.Boolean)
member.summary: True to clear all modified record information each time the store is loaded or when a record is removed. (defaults to false).

member.name: M:Ext.Net.StoreBase.Builder`2.RemoteSort(System.Boolean)
member.summary: True if sorting is to be handled by requesting the Proxy to provide a refreshed version of the data object in sorted order, as opposed to sorting the Record cache in place (defaults to false). If remote sorting is specified, then clicking on a column header causes the current page to be requested from the server with the addition of the following two parameters: sort: String - The name (as specified in the Record's Field definition) of the field to sort on. dir : String - The direction of the sort, 'ASC' or 'DESC' (case-sensitive).

member.name: M:Ext.Net.StoreBase.Builder`2.RemotePaging(System.Boolean)
member.summary: True to perform remote paging.

member.name: T:Ext.Net.ObjectComparer
member.summary: Utility class for comparing objects.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.ObjectComparer.GetDifferentProperties``1(``0,``0,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Reflection.PropertyInfo}@)
member.summary:
Compares the public properties of any 2 objects and determines if the properties of each all contain the same value.
In cases where object1 and object2 are of different Types (both being derived from Type T) we will cast both objects down to the base Type T to ensure the property comparison is only completed on COMMON properties. (ex. Type T is Foo, object1 is GoodFoo and object2 is BadFoo -- both being inherited from Foo -- both objects will be cast to Foo for comparison)
member.param: A List of objects that contain data on the properties from object1 that are not equal to the corresponding properties of object2.
member.returns: A boolean value indicating whether or not the properties of each object match.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.ObjectComparer.GetDifferentProperties``1(``0,``0,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Reflection.PropertyInfo},System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Reflection.PropertyInfo}@)
member.summary:
Compares the public properties of any 2 objects and determines if the properties of each all contain the same value.
In cases where object1 and object2 are of different Types (both being derived from Type T) we will cast both objects down to the base Type T to ensure the property comparison is only completed on COMMON properties. (ex. Type T is Foo, object1 is GoodFoo and object2 is BadFoo -- both being inherited from Foo -- both objects will be cast to Foo for comparison)
member.param: A list of objects to ignore when completing the comparison.
A List of objects that contain data on the properties from object1 that are not equal to the corresponding properties of object2.
member.returns: A boolean value indicating whether or not the properties of each object match.

member.summary:
Compares the public properties of any 2 objects and determines if the properties of each all contain the same value.
In cases where object1 and object2 are of different Types (both being derived from Type T) we will cast both objects down to the base Type T to ensure the property comparison is only completed on COMMON properties. (ex. Type T is Foo, object1 is GoodFoo and object2 is BadFoo -- both being inherited from Foo -- both objects will be cast to Foo for comparison)
member.returns: A boolean value indicating whether or not the properties of each object match.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.ObjectComparer.HasSamePropertyValues``1(``0,``0,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Reflection.PropertyInfo})
member.summary:
Compares the public properties of any 2 objects and determines if the properties of each all contain the same value.
In cases where object1 and object2 are of different Types (both being derived from Type T) we will cast both objects down to the base Type T to ensure the property comparison is only completed on COMMON properties. (ex. Type T is Foo, object1 is GoodFoo and object2 is BadFoo -- both being inherited from Foo -- both objects will be cast to Foo for comparison)
member.param: A list of objects to ignore when completing the comparison.

member.summary: True to prevent event propagation.

member.summary: False to pass a browser event to the handler function instead of an Ext.EventObject.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.HandlerConfig.Delay
member.summary: The number of milliseconds to delay the invocation of the handler after the event fires.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.HandlerConfig.Single
member.summary: True to add a handler to handle just the next firing of the event, and then remove itself.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.HandlerConfig.Buffer
member.summary: Causes the handler to be scheduled to run in an Ext.util.DelayedTask delayed by the specified number of milliseconds. If the event fires again within that time, the original handler is not invoked, but the new handler is scheduled in its place.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.HandlerConfig.Args

member.name: P:Ext.Net.HandlerConfig.Target
member.summary: Only call the handler if the event was fired on the target Observable, not if the event was bubbled up from a child Observable.

member.name: T:Ext.Net.CycleButton
member.summary: A specialized SplitButton that contains a menu of Ext.menu.CheckItem elements. The button automatically cycles through each menu items on click, raising the button's change event (or calling the button's changeHandler function, if supplied) for the active menu items. Clicking on the arrow section of the button displays the dropdown menu just like a normal SplitButton.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.CycleButton.ToggleSelected
member.summary: This is normally called internally on button click, but can be called externally to advance the button's active item programmatically to the next one in the menu. If the current item is the last one in the menu the active item will be set to the first item in the menu.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.CycleButton.ChangeHandler
member.summary: A callback function that will be invoked each time the active menu items in the button's menu has changed. If this callback is not supplied, the SplitButton will instead fire the change event on active items change. The changeHandler function will be called with the following argument list: (SplitButton this, Ext.menu.CheckItem items).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.CycleButton.ForceIcon
member.summary: A css class which sets an image to be used as the static icon for this button. This icon will always be displayed regardless of which item is selected in the dropdown list. This overrides the default behavior of changing the button's icon to match the selected item's icon on change.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.CycleButton.PrependText
member.summary: A static string to prepend before the active items's text when displayed as the button's text (only applies when showText = true, defaults to '')

member.name: P:Ext.Net.CycleButton.ShowText
member.summary: True to display the active items's text as the button text (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.CycleButton.ToggleOnClick
member.summary: False to prevent change active item after button click (defaults to true).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.CycleButton.Listeners
member.summary: Client-side JavaScript Event Handlers

member.name: P:Ext.Net.CycleButton.DirectEvents
member.summary: Server-side Ajax Event Handlers

member.name: T:Ext.Net.CheckboxSelectionModel
member.summary: A custom selection model that renders a column of checkboxes that can be toggled to select or deselect rows.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.CheckboxSelectionModel.CheckOnly
member.summary: true if rows can only be selected by clicking on the checkbox column (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.CheckboxSelectionModel.Header
member.summary:
Any valid text or HTML fragment to display in the header cell for the checkbox column (defaults to '
'). The default CSS class of 'x-grid3-hd-checker' displays a checkbox in the header and provides support for automatic check all/none behavior on header click. This string can be replaced by any valid HTML fragment, including a simple text string (e.g., 'Select Rows'), but the automatic check all/none behavior will only work if the 'x-grid3-hd-checker' class is supplied.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.CheckboxSelectionModel.Sortable
member.summary: True if the checkbox column is sortable (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.CheckboxSelectionModel.HideCheckAll
member.summary: True if need hide the checkbox in the header (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.CheckboxSelectionModel.AllowDeselect
member.summary: False if need disable deselection

member.summary: The default width in pixels of the checkbox column (defaults to 20).

member.name: M:Ext.Net.ExtNet.Get(System.Web.UI.Control)

member.param: The Control to get as an Element object.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.ExtNet.Fly(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the globally shared flyweight Element, with the passed node as the active element. Do not store a reference to this element - the dom node can be overwritten by other code. Shorthand of Ext.Element.fly Use this to make one-time references to DOM elements which are not going to be accessed again either by application code, or by Ext's classes. If accessing an element which will be processed regularly, then Ext.get will be more appropriate to take advantage of the caching provided by the Ext.Element class.

If accessing an element which will be processed regularly, then Ext.get will be more appropriate to take advantage of the caching provided by the Ext.Element class.
member.param: Allows for creation of named reusable flyweights to prevent conflicts

member.summary: Provides a convenient wrapper for normalized keyboard navigation. KeyNav allows you to bind navigation keys to function calls that will get called when the keys are pressed, providing an easy way to implement custom navigation schemes for any UI component.

member.name: T:Ext.Net.GridFilters
member.summary: GridFilter is a plugin for grids that allow for a slightly more robust representation of filtering than what is provided by the default store. Filtering is adjusted by the user using the grid's column header menu (this menu can be disabled through configuration). Through this menu users can configure, enable, and disable filters for each column.

member.name: T:Ext.Net.ResourcePlaceHolder
member.summary: Simple Container Control to allow for custom placement of Scripts and Styles in the <head> of the Page by the ResourceManager. If the Page does not contain a <ext:ResourcePlaceHolder> control, the <script>'s and <style>'s will be added as the last items in the <head>. The ResourceContainer does not render any HTML to the Page.

member.summary: The minimum allowed page Y for the element (only used for north resizing, defaults to 0)

member.summary: True to ensure that the resize handles are always visible, false to display them only when the user mouses over the resizable borders. This is only applied at config time. (defaults to false)

member.name: M:Ext.Net.ColumnModel.SetRenderer(System.Int32,Ext.Net.Renderer)
member.summary: Sets the rendering (formatting) function for a column. See Ext.util.Format for some default formatting functions. Parameters: col : Number The column index fn : Function The function to use to process the cell's raw data to return HTML markup for the grid view. The render function is called with the following parameters: value : Object The data value for the cell. metadata : Object An object in which you may set the following attributes: css : String A CSS class name to add to the cell's TD element. attr : String An HTML attribute definition string to apply to the data container element within the table cell (e.g. 'style="color:red;"'). record : Ext.data.record The Ext.data.Record from which the data was extracted. rowIndex : Number Row index colIndex : Number Column index store : Ext.data.Store The Ext.data.Store object from which the Record was extracted. Returns: void

member.name: T:Ext.Net.StatusBar
member.summary: Basic status bar component that can be used as the bottom toolbar of any Ext.Panel.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.StatusBar.ClearStatus
member.summary: Clears the status text and iconCls. Also supports clearing via an optional fade out animation.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.StatusBar.ClearStatus(Ext.Net.StatusBarClearStatusConfig)
member.summary: Clears the status text and iconCls. Also supports clearing via an optional fade out animation.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.StatusBar.SetIcon(Ext.Net.Icon)
member.summary: Convenience method for setting the status icon directly. For more flexible options see setStatus. See Icon or IconCls for complete details about customizing the icon. If empty string any iconCls will be cleared.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.StatusBar.SetIconClass(System.String)
member.summary: Convenience method for setting the status icon directly. For more flexible options see setStatus. See Icon or IconCls for complete details about customizing the icon. If empty string any iconCls will be cleared.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.StatusBar.SetStatus(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the status text and/or iconCls. Also supports automatically clearing the status that was set after a specified interval.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.StatusBar.SetStatus(Ext.Net.StatusBarStatusConfig)
member.summary: Sets the status text and/or iconCls. Also supports automatically clearing the status that was set after a specified interval.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.StatusBar.SetText(System.String)
member.summary: Convenience method for setting the status text directly. For more flexible options see setStatus.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.StatusBar.ShowBusy(System.String)
member.summary: Convenience method for setting the status text directly. For more flexible options see setStatus.
member.param: A string to use as the status text (in which case all other options for setStatus will be defaulted)

member.name: P:Ext.Net.StatusBar.AutoClear
member.summary: The number of milliseconds to wait after setting the status via setStatus before automatically clearing the status text and icon (defaults to 5000). Note that this only applies when passing the clear argument to setStatus since that is the only way to defer clearing the status. This can be overridden by specifying a different wait value in setStatus. Calls to clearStatus always clear the status bar immediately and ignore this value.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.StatusBar.BusyIcon
member.summary: The default Icon applied when calling showBusy (defaults to 'Icon.None'). It can be overridden at any time by passing the iconCls argument into showBusy. See the Icon or IconCls docs for additional details about customizing the icon.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.StatusBar.BusyIconCls
member.summary: The default iconCls applied when calling showBusy (defaults to 'x-status-busy'). It can be overridden at any time by passing the iconCls argument into showBusy. See the iconCls docs for additional details about customizing the icon.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.StatusBar.BusyText
member.summary: The default text applied when calling showBusy (defaults to 'Loading...'). It can be overridden at any time by passing the text argument into showBusy.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.StatusBar.Cls
member.summary: The base class applied to the containing element for this component on render (defaults to 'x-statusbar')

member.name: P:Ext.Net.StatusBar.DefaultIcon
member.summary: The default Icon (see the Icon or IconCls docs for additional details about customizing the icon). This will be used anytime the status bar is cleared with the useDefaults:true option (defaults to 'Icon.None').

member.name: P:Ext.Net.StatusBar.DefaultIconCls
member.summary: The default iconCls value (see the iconCls docs for additional details about customizing the icon). This will be used anytime the status bar is cleared with the useDefaults:true option (defaults to '').

member.name: P:Ext.Net.StatusBar.DefaultText
member.summary: The default text value. This will be used anytime the status bar is cleared with the useDefaults:true option (defaults to '').

member.name: P:Ext.Net.StatusBar.Icon
member.summary: An Icon that will be applied to the status element and is expected to provide a background image that will serve as the status bar icon (defaults to 'Icon.None'). The Icons is applied directly to the div that also contains the status text, so the rule should provide the appropriate padding on the div to make room for the image.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.StatusBar.IconCls
member.summary: A CSS class that will be applied to the status element and is expected to provide a background image that will serve as the status bar icon (defaults to ''). The class is applied directly to the div that also contains the status text, so the rule should provide the appropriate padding on the div to make room for the image.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.StatusBar.StatusAlign
member.summary: The alignment of the status element within the overall StatusBar layout. When the StatusBar is rendered, it creates an internal div containing the status text and icon. Any additional Toolbar items added in the StatusBar's items config, or added via add or any of the supported add* methods, will be rendered, in added order, to the opposite side. The status element is greedy, so it will automatically expand to take up all sapce left over by any other items.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.StatusBar.Text
member.summary: A string that will be rendered into the status element as the status message (defaults to '').

member.summary: Client-side JavaScript Event Handlers

Note that this only applies when passing the clear argument to setStatus since that is the only way to defer clearing the status. This can be overridden by specifying a different wait value in setStatus. Calls to clearStatus always clear the status bar immediately and ignore this value.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.StatusBar.Builder.BusyIcon(Ext.Net.Icon)
member.summary: The default Icon applied when calling showBusy (defaults to 'Icon.None'). It can be overridden at any time by passing the iconCls argument into showBusy. See the Icon or IconCls docs for additional details about customizing the icon.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.StatusBar.Builder.BusyIconCls(System.String)
member.summary: The default iconCls applied when calling showBusy (defaults to 'x-status-busy'). It can be overridden at any time by passing the iconCls argument into showBusy. See the iconCls docs for additional details about customizing the icon.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.StatusBar.Builder.BusyText(System.String)
member.summary: The default text applied when calling showBusy (defaults to 'Loading...'). It can be overridden at any time by passing the text argument into showBusy.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.StatusBar.Builder.Cls(System.String)
member.summary: The base class applied to the containing element for this component on render (defaults to 'x-statusbar')

member.name: M:Ext.Net.StatusBar.Builder.DefaultIcon(Ext.Net.Icon)
member.summary: The default Icon (see the Icon or IconCls docs for additional details about customizing the icon). This will be used anytime the status bar is cleared with the useDefaults:true option (defaults to 'Icon.None').

member.name: M:Ext.Net.StatusBar.Builder.DefaultIconCls(System.String)
member.summary: The default iconCls value (see the iconCls docs for additional details about customizing the icon). This will be used anytime the status bar is cleared with the useDefaults:true option (defaults to '').

member.name: M:Ext.Net.StatusBar.Builder.DefaultText(System.String)
member.summary: The default text value. This will be used anytime the status bar is cleared with the useDefaults:true option (defaults to '').

member.name: M:Ext.Net.StatusBar.Builder.Icon(Ext.Net.Icon)
member.summary: An Icon that will be applied to the status element and is expected to provide a background image that will serve as the status bar icon (defaults to 'Icon.None'). The Icons is applied directly to the div that also contains the status text, so the rule should provide the appropriate padding on the div to make room for the image.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.StatusBar.Builder.IconCls(System.String)
member.summary: A CSS class that will be applied to the status element and is expected to provide a background image that will serve as the status bar icon (defaults to ''). The class is applied directly to the div that also contains the status text, so the rule should provide the appropriate padding on the div to make room for the image.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.StatusBar.Builder.StatusAlign(Ext.Net.StatusAlign)
member.summary: The alignment of the status element within the overall StatusBar layout. When the StatusBar is rendered, it creates an internal div containing the status text and icon. Any additional Toolbar items added in the StatusBar's items config, or added via add or any of the supported add* methods, will be rendered, in added order, to the opposite side. The status element is greedy, so it will automatically expand to take up all sapce left over by any other items.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.StatusBar.Builder.Text(System.String)
member.summary: A string that will be rendered into the status element as the status message (defaults to '').

member.name: T:Ext.Net.DropZone
member.summary: This class provides a container DD instance that allows dropping on multiple child target nodes. By default, this class requires that child nodes accepting drop are registered with Ext.dd.Registry. However a simpler way to allow a DropZone to manage any number of target elements is to configure the DropZone with an implementation of getTargetFromEvent which interrogates the passed mouse event to see if it has taken place within an element, or class of elements. This is easily done by using the event's getTarget method to identify a node based on a Ext.DomQuery selector. Once the DropZone has detected through calling getTargetFromEvent, that the mouse is over a drop target, that target is passed as the first parameter to onNodeEnter, onNodeOver, onNodeOut, onNodeDrop. You may configure the instance of DropZone with implementations of these methods to provide application-specific behaviour for these events to update both application state, and UI state.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DropZone.GetTargetFromEvent
member.summary: Returns a custom data object associated with the DOM node that is the target of the event. By default this looks up the event target in the Ext.dd.Registry, although you can override this method to provide your own custom lookup. Parameters: e : The event

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DropZone.OnContainerDrop
member.summary: Called when the DropZone determines that a Ext.dd.DragSource has been dropped on it, but not on any of its registered drop nodes. The default implementation returns false, so it should be overridden to provide the appropriate processing of the drop event if you need the drop zone itself to be able to accept drops. It should return true when valid so that the drag source's repair action does not run. Parameters: source : The drag source that was dragged over this drop zone e : The event data : An object containing arbitrary data supplied by the drag source

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DropZone.OnContainerOver
member.summary: Called while the DropZone determines that a Ext.dd.DragSource is being dragged over it, but not over any of its registered drop nodes. The default implementation returns this.dropNotAllowed, so it should be overridden to provide the proper feedback if necessary. Parameters: source : The drag source that was dragged over this drop zone e : The event data : An object containing arbitrary data supplied by the drag source

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DropZone.OnNodeDrop
member.summary: Called when the DropZone determines that a Ext.dd.DragSource has been dropped onto the drop node. The default implementation returns false, so it should be overridden to provide the appropriate processing of the drop event and return true so that the drag source's repair action does not run. Parameters: nodeData : The custom data associated with the drop node (this is the same value returned from getTargetFromEvent for this node) source : The drag source that was dragged over this drop zone e : The event data : An object containing arbitrary data supplied by the drag source

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DropZone.OnNodeEnter
member.summary: Called when the DropZone determines that a Ext.dd.DragSource has entered a drop node that has either been registered or detected by a configured implementation of getTargetFromEvent. This method has no default implementation and should be overridden to provide node-specific processing if necessary. Parameters: nodeData : The custom data associated with the drop node (this is the same value returned from getTargetFromEvent for this node) source : The drag source that was dragged over this drop zone e : The event data : An object containing arbitrary data supplied by the drag source

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DropZone.OnNodeOut
member.summary: Called when the DropZone determines that a Ext.dd.DragSource has been dragged out of the drop node without dropping. This method has no default implementation and should be overridden to provide node-specific processing if necessary. Parameters: nodeData : The custom data associated with the drop node (this is the same value returned from getTargetFromEvent for this node) source : The drag source that was dragged over this drop zone e : The event data : An object containing arbitrary data supplied by the drag source

member.name: P:Ext.Net.DropZone.OnNodeOver
member.summary: Called while the DropZone determines that a Ext.dd.DragSource is over a drop node that has either been registered or detected by a configured implementation of getTargetFromEvent. The default implementation returns this.dropNotAllowed, so it should be overridden to provide the proper feedback. Parameters: nodeData : The custom data associated with the drop node (this is the same value returned from getTargetFromEvent for this node) source : The drag source that was dragged over this drop zone e : The event data : An object containing arbitrary data supplied by the drag source

member.name: T:Ext.Net.ToolTip
member.summary: A standard tooltip implementation for providing additional information when hovering over a target element.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.ToolTip.Update(System.String)
member.summary: Update the html of the Body, optionally searching for and processing scripts.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ToolTip.AnchorOffset
member.summary: A numeric pixel value used to offset the default position of the anchor arrow (defaults to 0). When the anchor position is on the top or bottom of the tooltip, anchorOffset will be used as a horizontal offset. Likewise, when the anchor position is on the left or right side, anchorOffset will be used as a vertical offset.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ToolTip.AnchorToTarget
member.summary: True to anchor the tooltip to the target element, false to anchor it relative to the mouse coordinates (defaults to true). When anchorToTarget is true, use defaultAlign to control tooltip alignment to the target element. When anchorToTarget is false, use anchorPosition instead to control alignment.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ToolTip.AutoHide
member.summary: True to automatically hide the tooltip after the mouse exits the target element or after the dismissDelay has expired if set (defaults to true). If closable = true a close tool button will be rendered into the tooltip header.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ToolTip.Delegate
member.summary: Optional. A DomQuery selector which allows selection of individual elements within the target element to trigger showing and hiding the ToolTip as the mouse moves within the target. When specified, the child element of the target which caused a show event is placed into the triggerElement property before the ToolTip is shown. This may be useful when a Component has regular, repeating elements in it, each of which need a Tooltip which contains information specific to that element.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ToolTip.DismissDelay
member.summary: Delay in milliseconds before the tooltip automatically hides (defaults to 5000). To disable automatic hiding, set dismissDelay = 0.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ToolTip.HideDelay
member.summary: Delay in milliseconds after the mouse exits the target element but before the tooltip actually hides (defaults to 200). Set to 0 for the tooltip to hide immediately.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ToolTip.MouseOffset
member.summary: An XY offset from the mouse position where the tooltip should be shown (defaults to [15,18]).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ToolTip.ShowDelay
member.summary: Delay in milliseconds before the tooltip displays after the mouse enters the target element (defaults to 500).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ToolTip.Target
member.summary: The target id to associate with this tooltip.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ToolTip.TrackMouse
member.summary: True to have the tooltip follow the mouse as it moves over the target element (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ToolTip.Listeners
member.summary: Client-side JavaScript Event Handlers

member.name: P:Ext.Net.ToolTip.DirectEvents
member.summary: Server-side Ajax Event Handlers

member.name: T:Ext.Net.RecordField
member.summary: The field definition object which specify field names, and optionally, data types, and a mapping for an Reader to extract the field's value from a data object.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.RecordField.AllowBlank
member.summary: Used for validating a record, defaults to true. An empty value here will cause Ext.data.Record.isValid to evaluate to false.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.RecordField.Name
member.summary: The name by which the field is referenced within the Record. This is referenced by, for example the DataIndex property in column definition objects passed to ColumnModel

member.name: P:Ext.Net.RecordField.Mapping
member.summary:
(Optional) A path specification for use by the Reader implementation that is creating the Record to access the data value from the data object.
If an JsonReader is being used, then this is a string containing the javascript expression to reference the data relative to the Record item's root.
If an XmlReader is being used, this is an Ext.DomQuery path to the data item relative to the Record element.
If the mapping expression is the same as the field name, this may be omitted.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.RecordField.Type
member.summary: The data type for conversion to displayable value

member.name: P:Ext.Net.RecordField.SortType
member.summary: Sort method

member.name: P:Ext.Net.RecordField.SortDir
member.summary: (Optional) Initial direction to sort

member.name: P:Ext.Net.RecordField.SubmitEmptyValue
member.summary: Empty value representation during submit (default value as Undedefined)

member.name: P:Ext.Net.RecordField.CustomSortType
member.summary: A function which converts a Field's value to a comparable value in order to ensure correct sort ordering.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.RecordField.Convert
member.summary:
(Optional) A function which converts the value provided by the Reader into an object that will be stored in the Record.
It is passed the following parameters: v : Mixed The data value as read by the Reader.
rec : Mixed The data object containting the row as read by the Reader. Depending on Reader type, this could be an Array, an object, or an XML element.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.RecordField.DateFormat
member.summary: (Optional) A format String for the Date.parseDate function

member.name: P:Ext.Net.RecordField.DefaultValue
member.summary:
(Optional) The default value passed to the Reader when the field does not exist in the data object
Please pay attention that if you use string const then need wrap like this DefaultValue="'String const'"

member.name: P:Ext.Net.RecordField.IsComplex
member.summary: True to render this property as complex object

member.name: M:Ext.Net.Cookies.Clear(System.String)
member.summary: Removes a cookie with the provided name from the browser if found by setting its expiration date to sometime in the past.
member.param: The name of the cookie to remove

member.name: M:Ext.Net.Cookies.GetValue(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves cookie value that are accessible by the current page. If a cookie does not exist, get() returns null.
member.param: The name of the cookie to get
member.returns: Returns the cookie value for the specified name; null if the cookie name does not exist.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.Cookies.GetCookie(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves cookie that are accessible by the current page. If a cookie does not exist, get() returns null.
member.param: The name of the cookie to get
member.returns: Returns the cookie for the specified name; null if the cookie name does not exist.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.Cookies.Set(System.String,System.Object,System.DateTime,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Create a cookie with the specified name and value. Additional settings for the cookie may be optionally specified (for example: expiration, access restriction, SSL).
member.param: The name of the cookie to set.
The value to set for the cookie.
Specify an expiration date the cookie is to persist until. Note that the specified Date object will be converted to Greenwich Mean Time (GMT).
Setting a path on the cookie restricts access to pages that match that path. Defaults to all pages ('/').

Setting a domain restricts access to pages on a given domain (typically used to allow cookie access across subdomains). For example, "ext.net" will create a cookie that can be accessed from any subdomain of ext.net, including www.ext.net, support.ext.net, etc.

Specify true to indicate that the cookie should only be accessible via SSL on a page using the HTTPS protocol. Defaults to false. Note that this will only work if the page calling this code uses the HTTPS protocol, otherwise the cookie will be created with default options.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.Element.Get(System.Web.UI.Control)
member.summary: Retrieves Ext.Element objects. This method does not retrieve Components. This method retrieves Ext.Element objects which encapsulate DOM elements. Uses simple caching to consistently return the same object. Automatically fixes if an object was recreated with the same id via AJAX or DOM.
member.param: The Control to get as an Element object.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.Element.Get(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves Ext.Element objects. This method does not retrieve Components. This method retrieves Ext.Element objects which encapsulate DOM elements. Uses simple caching to consistently return the same object. Automatically fixes if an object was recreated with the same id via AJAX or DOM.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.Element.Fly(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the globally shared flyweight Element, with the passed node as the active element. Do not store a reference to this element - the dom node can be overwritten by other code. Shorthand of Ext.Element.fly Use this to make one-time references to DOM elements which are not going to be accessed again either by application code, or by Ext's classes. If accessing an element which will be processed regularly, then Ext.get will be more appropriate to take advantage of the caching provided by the Ext.Element class.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.Element.Fly(System.Web.UI.Control)

Shorthand of Ext.Element.fly Use this to make one-time references to DOM elements which are not going to be accessed again either by application code, or by Ext's classes. If accessing an element which will be processed regularly, then Ext.get will be more appropriate to take advantage of the caching provided by the Ext.Element class.
member.param: The Control to get as an Element object.

If accessing an element which will be processed regularly, then Ext.get will be more appropriate to take advantage of the caching provided by the Ext.Element class.
member.param: Allows for creation of named reusable flyweights to prevent conflicts

member.name: M:Ext.Net.Element.BoxWrap(System.String)
member.summary: Wraps the specified element with a special 9 element markup/CSS block that renders by default as a gray container with a gradient background, rounded corners and a 4-way shadow. This special markup is used throughout Ext when box wrapping elements (Ext.Button, Ext.Panel when frame=true, Ext.Window).
member.param: A base CSS class to apply to the containing wrapper element (defaults to 'x-box'). Note that there are a number of CSS rules that are dependent on this name to make the overall effect work, so if you supply an alternate base class, make sure you also supply all of the necessary rules.

member.summary: Fades the element out while slowly expanding it in all directions. When the effect is completed, the element will be hidden (visibility = 'hidden') but block elements will still take up space in the document. The element must be removed from the DOM using the 'remove' config option if desired.
member.param: Object literal with any of the Fx config options

member.name: M:Ext.Net.Element.Shift(Ext.Net.ShiftConfig)
member.summary: Animates the transition of any combination of an element's dimensions, xy position and/or opacity. Any of these properties not specified in the config object will not be changed. This effect requires that at least one new dimension, position or opacity setting must be passed in on the config object in order for the function to have any effect.
member.param: Object literal with any of the Fx config options

Object literal with any of the Fx config options

member.name: M:Ext.Net.Element.SlideOut(System.String,Ext.Net.FxConfig)
member.summary: Slides the element out of view. An anchor point can be optionally passed to set the end point for the slide effect. When the effect is completed, the element will be hidden (visibility = 'hidden') but block elements will still take up space in the document. The element must be removed from the DOM using the 'remove' config option if desired. This function automatically handles wrapping the element with a fixed-size container if needed.
member.param: One of the valid Fx anchor positions (defaults to top: 't')
Object literal with any of the Fx config options

member.name: M:Ext.Net.Element.SwitchOff(Ext.Net.FxConfig)
member.summary: Blinks the element as if it was clicked and then collapses on its center (similar to switching off a television). When the effect is completed, the element will be hidden (visibility = 'hidden') but block elements will still take up space in the document. The element must be removed from the DOM using the 'remove' config option if desired.
member.param: Object literal with any of the Fx config options

member.name: M:Ext.Net.Element.SwitchOff
member.summary: Blinks the element as if it was clicked and then collapses on its center (similar to switching off a television). When the effect is completed, the element will be hidden (visibility = 'hidden') but block elements will still take up space in the document. The element must be removed from the DOM using the 'remove' config option if desired.

member.name: M:Ext.Net.Element.SyncFx
member.summary: Ensures that all effects queued after syncFx is called on the element are run concurrently. This is the opposite of sequenceFx.

For example: 0.000,00/i

member.name: T:Ext.Net.SlideOut
member.summary: Slides the element out of view. An anchor point can be optionally passed to set the end point for the slide effect. When the effect is completed, the element will be hidden (visibility = 'hidden') but block elements will still take up space in the document. The element must be removed from the DOM using the 'remove' config option if desired. This function automatically handles wrapping the element with a fixed-size container if needed.

member.name: T:Ext.Net.SlideIn
member.summary: Slides the element into view. An anchor point can be optionally passed to set the point of origin for the slide effect. This function automatically handles wrapping the element with a fixed-size container if needed.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.SlideIn.Anchor
member.summary: One of the valid Fx anchor positions (defaults to AnchorPoint.CenterTop)

member.name: T:Ext.Net.Ghost
member.summary: Slides the element while fading it out of view. An anchor point can be optionally passed to set the ending point of the effect.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.Ghost.Anchor
member.summary: One of the valid Fx anchor positions (defaults to AnchorPoint.CenterBottom)

member.name: T:Ext.Net.WaitConfig
member.summary: A config object containing any or all of the following properties. If this object is not specified the status will be cleared using the defaults.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.WaitConfig.Duration
member.summary: The length of time in milliseconds that the progress bar should run before resetting itself (defaults to undefined, in which case it will run indefinitely until reset is called)

member.name: P:Ext.Net.WaitConfig.Interval
member.summary: The length of time in milliseconds between each progress update (defaults to 1000 ms)

member.name: P:Ext.Net.WaitConfig.Increment
member.summary: The number of progress update segments to display within the progress bar (defaults to 10). If the bar reaches the end and is still updating, it will automatically wrap back to the beginning.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.WaitConfig.Text
member.summary: Optional text to display in the progress bar element (defaults to '').

member.name: P:Ext.Net.WaitConfig.Fn
member.summary: A callback function to execute after the progress bar finishes auto-updating. The function will be called with no arguments. This function will be ignored if duration is not specified since in that case the progress bar can only be stopped programmatically, so any required function should be called by the same code after it resets the progress bar.

member.name: P:Ext.Net.WaitConfig.Scope
member.summary: The scope that is passed to the callback function (only applies when duration and fn are both passed).
